In the three nights we stayed, at least three rooms were broken into. please stay in any other hotel, there is no way it could be such a blatant attempt to rip you off with poor quality and high costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied indeed on the whole!”
Reviews.Author: LWBS
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in a fairly good & convenient area. Plenty of restaurants, shops etc in the vicinity. Absolutely safe to walk/stroll in the night. Subway station "96th street" just around the corner. Able to reach mid-town Manhattan within 10 minutes on the express train. Hotel staffs are friendly & ever ready to assist with enqueries/infos. Hotel room (the one we had) attached with shower, had all the basic amenities. Extras like hair dryer, iron & ironing board, user friendly safe as well as a coffee maschine comes in really handy. Comfortable bed with clean bed sheets and daily change of bath towels were a welcome. There was also a t.v & an air-conditioner. The only downside is that, room is freezing cold even though heater is at maximum, due to non isolated windows. Carpet on the floor needs thorough cleaning, but with bedroom slippers will do the trick. Both lifts/elevators are operative, but, gives an unsafe feeling. Light sleepers will have a bit of a problem, as walls of rooms are quite thin.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Ever Stayed at - Avoid at All Costs”
Reviews.Author: BostonRico
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outdated and dirty and I would never stay there again. Here are the bad points: The hotel must not have been updated for 50 years. There was peeling paint and peeling wallpaper everywhere. The rugs were old, stained, and disgusting. The bedspreads were stained. There was exposed wiring in the elevator. The room had old windows that let cold air through. There was a through-the-wall air conditioner that wasn't covered, thus it was very drafty. There was one heat radiator and guest could not control the heat in their own room. The water that came through the shower head was often brown in color. There was no internet in guest rooms. Internet in lobby was very, very slow. No clock or alarm clock in room. Beds were very short. The elevators were slow. There was police crime scene tape on the door of a room across the hallway. THe good points were: The hotel was located in a very safe and convenient area. The hotel was cheap (about $100 per night). The bathrooms were renovated and in very good shape. Despite the low price, I would never, ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a good place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: dehaircottage
Reviews.Content: this hotel was right where you could,walk to everything. shopping,subway,coffee shop.just a cozy little place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Honest_now
Reviews.Content: Purchased flight/hotel package on Expedia and saved $600, plus hundreds from price of other rooms in Manhattan that were $200 or more. Private bath, very hot water at all hours, comfortable bed and quiet room (window faced another building but who sits and looks at view when you can get out in NYC). Only problem with broken safety latch and hair dyer were both fixed by the time we got back to the hotel on Saturday. Safe in room. Location is one block down from the 95th street entrance to the 96/Broadway subway stop which was major convenient and got us anywhere in the city in minutes. 15 minute walk to Central park with the Met on the other side. 24 hour drugstore next door. Starbucks and McDonalds nearby. Enjoyed the residential feel of this upper west side neighborhood. Second time staying here and have felt the staff is helpful both times. Pay computer downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQ1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn on 94th and Broadway for four nights. This was our second experience staying at this hotel. Our room was much larger this time as it was a corner room and just as clean as the time before. There were NO BEDBUGS. One bank of elevators is rather old but we avoid using them and always catch the newer ones. The Days Inn is close to the subway, Central Park and a great restaurant for breakfast, Key West. When we go to NYC, we are hardly ever in the room except to sleep because there is so much to see and do so this works perfectly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a clean place to stay, close to the subway and doesn't need all the amenities of an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: SCP60745
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. It is dirty and overpriced. Room numbers are etched in or taped on to the doors. The elevator was sketchy, the phone was broken, no plug in sink. I slept in my clothes. No wifi. You can stay at other hotels nearby that are much nicer like On the Avenue - only $50 more. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You get EXACTLY what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: benmiralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you more than what your typical two star hotel usually does. The lobby is spacious and clean. There is even a desk set up where you can reserve and pay for airport shuttles and city tours. Every person I dealt with was professional and corteous. Whether I needed directions or meal recomendations the staff was helpful and knowledgeable. There are two banks of elevators and while they are slow and small they go up and down. My room (214) was larger than I expected and had a really nice bed, a dresser, television (with remote), iron, ironing board, safe, hair dryer, coffee maker, steam heat, and air conditioning. The bathroom had soap, face soap, and lotion. The sheets and towels were exceptionally clean and I had to tell them not to change the sheets every day and only replace the towels if I put them on the floor. This is not an upscale hotel. But you get everything you would usually get, just not as nice. The lotion was Days Inn brand, not aveda, the t.v. only had 25 channels and basic cable. No HBO. But you can live through that. The hotel itself has a business center with two desktops, Wi Fi in the lobby only (again...You'll live), a really nice fitness center, a coin operated laundromat inside the hotel, and vending machines on all the floors. There is a major subway stop at the corner (A, B, C lines as well as 1 and 2) you can get anywhere in the city from there. There are about 25 restaurants within a four block radius and a Starbucks right around the corner. A CVS and another similar store within two blocks. Two outdoor markets and a news stand within three blocks. There is an Indian Restaurant and an asian restaurant directly across the street from the hotel. My two favorite restaurants were the City Diner at 90th and Carmines (also at 90th). You are four blocks from Central Park and three blocks from riverside park the other way. I will definitely be staying here again. The subway stop alone makes it worthwhile. I was in town to run the marathon and they were giving out coupons for a nearby restaurant for a discounted breakfast just for the runners. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Upper West Side bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: scottycatt
Reviews.Content: I was in the city to participate in the New York City Marathon. I chose this hotel based on its location, price and the fact that it offered private, rather than shared, bathrooms that seem to be common in hotels in this price range. I booked this hotel months in advance, as hotels on marathon weekend book up early and at some pretty outrageous prices! I held my breath and hoped that I wouldn't be arriving to find a dump. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel was located across the street from the 96th St. subway station, as I was traveling with several bags and the thought of hiking down busy streets in cold weather for blocks on end did not appeal. (I later discovered a 2nd subway entrance just outside the hotel's entrance.) I had flown into JFK and taken the A train, then transferred to the 1 Uptown train. (This was a HUGE money saver -- about $7.50 vs. $45 cab + tolls + tip. Took just over an hour, not bad!) Check-in wasn't supposed to be until 3pm (I think), but the nice young man at the front desk said he could let me go ahead and check in, and he even upgraded me to a king! He even told me the best way to get down to midtown, where I would be headed later. He was really friendly and helpful. I got up to my room after managing to make my way out of the narrow elevator and find my way around the maze-like hallways. I was very pleasantly surprised when I got inside the room. Lovely king-sized bed with lots of extra pillows and extra velour blanket. Nice view of surrounding apartment buildings, as well as an overhead view of the city streets below. Coffeemaker, complete with extra packs of coffee and necessities -- super nice, when one is trying to travel on a budget. (Saved me from having to hit up Starbucks for my caffeine fix and was nice to know that I could have coffee on my early morning race day of 4 am!) Now came the make-or-break part of the room -- the bathroom. Much to my delight I found a nice, large, bright and CLEAN, modern bathroom. Tiled floor, granite counter-top and roomy bathtub, with overhead shower. No moldy grout, no yucky-looking toilet -- everything looked like new!! Whew!! No matter if the rest of the trip went sour, I knew I would be able to get a good night's sleep and be able to enjoy a nice soak after the marathon! I deducted one star for the condition of the carpet - it looked worn and a bit dirty. No matter as I never walk around in bare feet in a hotel room, anyway. I always pack flip-flops for this purpose. The rest of the room and bathroom were sparkling clean. Now to my one true complaint -- more an annoyance, really. I could not connect to the internet from my room, even though wireless internet is offered, free of charge. I called downstairs and the clerk told me I shouldn't be having any problems getting connected to their network. I spent over an hour of frustration trying to get online and finally gave up and went downstairs to address the problem in person. I was told by another clerk that I would need to bring my computer to the hotel's lobby, as the signal wasn't accessible from the hotel rooms. OK. I just wish the first person I'd spoken to would've told me this, and saved me the hour I wasted trying to connect from my room! I had plenty of company in the lobby, as at least a dozen other people were also working from their laptops. I was able to stay connected but the internet speed was a bit slow. Still, it worked and the hotel doesn't charge extra for it, so I was very happy about that! I spent 3 nights here and for the price I paid -- $169/night -- I considered it a real value! I knew other marathoners who were staying in midtown who paid at least twice as much per night as I did. I didn't bother to check whether this hotel offered any sort of room service, but when you've got so many food choices just outside your door in NYC, why bother? I don't think the hotel had any sort of restaurant. Not sure about workout facilities. I knew I would get plenty of exercise just walking around the city, not to mention the marathon I would be running during my stay:=) All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great value in a nice location! Hotel is situated at 94th/Broadway, so a walk of a few blocks will put you near Central Park West and there are all sorts of great places to eat, drink and people watch! If any future marathoners are looking for a great, convenient place to stay, this hotel is easily within about a 10 - 12 minute walk, once you've crossed the finish line in Central Park. Lots of places to grab a brew and a burger in the area, too! Book early and save yourself some money and get everything you need, all in one location!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: Alidah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights and found it to be very good value for money. Great position with Restaurants close by and a $10 cab ride to Times Square. Beds were very comfortable and although it is an older hotel, we found it very clean and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “UGH!!!”
Reviews.Author: Taxdiva74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went last weekend for my birthday traveling from Chicago. We wanted to save money on a room and have more money to shop/tour. Seemed like a good idea. I was told the Hotel had free Wifi, they never said ONLY IN THE LOBBY. The heat was an OLD radiator you can NOT control your own heat. Infact, it got so cold in my room I had to call for another blanket which is when I was told that it wasn't cold enough to turn on the heat, and when they did it was set to 45 degrees!!! The engineer finally came with a portable heater, which was a life saver! The "manager" Rosalynn {who is NOT a manager} told me perhaps I got a sheet {like I don't know the difference between a sheet and a blanket}, and perhaps I could sleep in MORE CLOTHES !!!! My room was small but that part was okay since we only wanted to sleep and shower there. BUT I couldn't get a good shower because my shower was nasty, and it has tile cracking and falling into the bottom of the tub, ugh!! When you call and ask for a manager, everyone pretends to be a manager! First Rosalynn, then Nicole. I have left SEVERAL messages for the hotel manager Willie, who NEVER called me back! Coral was very nice but I cant reach her, she's been off for a couple of days now. STAY AWAY FROM ROOM 1029!! THE WALLS, WALLPAPER, CARPET, AND BATHROOM WERE ABSOLUTELY NASTY!!! DO NOT STAY HERE WITHOUT LYSOL, BLEACH SPRAY, SHOWER SHOES, AND HOUSE SHOES. BRING YOUR OWN TOWELS!! The flip side to this is that it is an okay location, easy to get a cab, close to central park, and next door to a pharmacy {to pick up your lysol, etc.}. Don't go with ANY expectations or you will be disappointed. The bellman was very nice. The air worked great except we needed the heat since it was cold October nights. The TV did only get minimal stations, but that wasn't a problem since we watch minimal TV, and the bed was comfortable, and NO BEDBUGS! But beward, they say close to restaurants and shops, what they mean is Payless Shoes and McDonald's is across the street. Not convenient for nightlife, chinatown, downtown, times square, etc. I spent hundreds of dollars in cabs/tips to go eat, party, shop, etc..The elevator is old, and scary, and tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate; great location; nice, spacious, clean, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Elman1952
Reviews.Content: We travel to New York frequently for pleasure. The hotel rates have gotten very pricey and we hate to spend a lot on a room because the only time we spend in the hotel room is to sleep and shower. I read the reviews on TripAdvisor, so I was very leery of booking this Days Inn, but the rate was so low compared to other 2 and 3 star hotels in Manhattan, I figured, "What the heck...if it's really awful, we'll just stay one night, then move." Well, the place was great, for the price. The room was clean, and rather large for a New York hotel room. The bathroom had been very recently updated, so it was very nice. The staff was attentive and helpful. I really couldn't figure out what all the negative reviews were about. There were no bedbugs, plenty of hot water for our showers, the AC worked great, it was very quiet and we slept like logs. The only things that I could agree with from some of the negative reviews are: One of the two sets of elevators was a little rickety, and the TV only got the 13 broadcast channels, but so what? We didn't go to NYC to watch TV! It was very conveniently located right next to an express subway stop, so we were just two stops from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: michele_from_canada
Reviews.Content: Where to begin?? This hotel had horrible service. The manager "Nicole" was non-existent during our 5 day stay. We were shuffled around rooms, and called liars when we pointed out the things that weren't working. The windows are taped shut with duct tape. The walls had mould and blood, it was horribly creepy. We stayed in winter and the radiator in the room was very noisy, clicking and hissing. Bring earplugs. The hallways were so small my bag kept hitting the walls as I walked. The only good point is that it's not TOO expensive if you shop around for a deal. also, it's near a subway station which is on the express route so getting downtown is quick and easy. I would not recommend this hotel and I would not go back. All we wanted was a place to sleep and shower while traveling on a budget, but this 2 star hotel couldn't even give us the bare minimum. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Really bad service!”
Reviews.Author: Helene87
Reviews.Content: - We were ignored by the staff several times. They were more interested in talking to eacother. At the end we gave up asking them anything. - They didn't want to call a restaurant for making a reservation for us. - Three times the staff laughed at us, they thought we asked stupid questions. - We didn't see a single smile all week. - The door to the room had a big gap all way around, so we could see people walking in the hallway from our bed. - The bed was old and made noises so it was difficult to sleep. - The high speed internet was not high speed, and there were no internett access in the room. - Four elevators, but still we had to wait about 10 min each time we were going to use one of them, and it always stopped in the wrong floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bineyehcha
Reviews.Content: Clean (the room and bathroom were cleaned every day. they gave us more towels than we needed and changed them every day), friendly staff, the room was just what you need (with a good but a bit noisy AC, and a TV with a good choice of channels), the bell captain/luggage service was perfect. nothing was decieving or annoying, except the fact that it has no restaurant. but the hotel is located in a area where u can find EVERYTHING (grocery shops, restaurants, coffee shops, pharmacy, dry cleaning service, etc etc). the location is good (u can find anything you need) but a bit far from downtown manhattan. i was positively surprised with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value for Broadway”
Reviews.Author: sollymolly
Reviews.Content: After reading few negative reviews about this hotel, we were a bit afraid of what we could get but...we only have good things to say about it. It is sutuate just off Broadway street away from the busy street. Very near the metro subway, restaurants, coffee shops (Starbucks around the corner with free wi-fi and a supermaket with a nice deli section. Definetly good value for money - You cant go wrong if you dont expect luxury but a basic clean and quite place to sleep after your day walks.

Reviews.Title: “To Expensive For Stay With Out Any Amenities”
Reviews.Author: MrsB516
Reviews.Content: I don't think this hotel should be so expensive for what it offers, there are no upgrades, TV are old & just regular channels not even basic cable, the beds are old & springs are sticking out. If you don't be careful to getting in & out the bed you will get cut or scratched. toilets easily get clogged, the shower water is always changing. Staying here is if there are no other places to go. The staff are great & very sweet & always willing to help. To bad there not the one's who own & run the hotel. Prices are always competing with other hotels but they don't have amenities so if there is no other place to go then go but if u get something better for the same price or cheaper then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “AN OVERPRICED DUMP. PERIOD!”
Reviews.Author: trinboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitome of American Greed. Imagine a dump like this demanding rates of $289.00 for my first night, and yes, $490.00 for my 2nd and 3rd Nights stay. The carpets are so filthy you don't want to even put your feet down, and you are afraid to touch everything else. The Furniture is overused, filthy, and just despicable and they pay absolutely no attention to details beyond swiping your C/C, engaging Usury practices based on the greed of increasing Reservations as they choose to forget that they are RENTING you a room, and unconcerned as to WHAT one is paying for as they prey on the vulnerable traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for New York”
Reviews.Author: matsMontreal
Reviews.Content: Good 2 stars hotel for NYC. Very close to 96 subway station so very easy to travel in the city. The room was clean and big enough for new york. The ac was way too loud and the elevator can load five person max. They got wi-fi in the lobby. Will come back to this hotel for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to my worst enemy...”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl648
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC many times and have stayed at hotels in the city and in jersey. We stayed at this hotel for a girls weekend and it could not have been worse. After a long train ride, we all wanted to have a shower. As the first one was showering, the water wouldn't drain so we called for maintenance to come up and have a look. He let himself into the room, then told us that he was done his shift in 15 mins so he couldn't snake the drain. We went down to the concierge to complain and they moved us to a new room after 30mins of me trying to convince him that the water wasn't draining. In the second room, there was significant mold (even on the portraits) and red smears on the bathroom wall. After complaining again, we were told that there were no rooms left and they would "deal with us in the morning." The next morning we went down to the desk and were told that there was another room, which turned out to be okay. We wanted to talk to a manager about. He poor service/cleanliness of the hotel and were continually given the run around. They hung up the phone on us, called us names (brats, drama queen). It was horrible! When we checked out, we were told the manager was going to call us but that never happened. We were also suppose to receive 25% off our night but that never happened either. There are many other hotels in the city and surrounding area that are a million times better! The Marriott eastside and downtown are excellent and won't cost that much more than this dump. Also, the sherton Lincoln harbor is amazing! There is a coach bus that takes you from the hotel to times square and its literally a 10 min ride. The rooms are huge and the staff are wonderful! I wouldn't even recommend the days hotel if you are looking for a place for a dog to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you just want a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: egranville
Reviews.Content: As former residents of Manhattan, we knew we wanted to stay at a hotel on the Upper West Side for convenience, accessibility, and safety. In terms of location, this hotel met our expectations. It is right off Broadway, 2 blocks from a major subway stop (for local and express trains) and cross-town bus, and we were even able to find on-street parking. This neighborhood is full of shops (big and small), great restaurants (formal and casual), and conveniences (like banks, pharmacies, and coffee shops). As for this hotel, we chose it primarily because of the price, and because we had heard from family who had stayed there that it was clean and presentable. We did find our room to be relatively clean, except for the massive stains on the carpet. The room was certainly not fancy, with dated decor, a worn mattress, and flimsy towels. It was also obvious that over the years, shoddy repairs had been made to a number of things like the fire sprinkler (poor drywall repair) and the towel rack (which was barely affixed to the wall). Overall though, I think we would stay here again since we don't go to NYC to find glitz and glam in our hotel, but to experience the city, on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: asuathena
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel, I came on to TripAdvisor and read all of the horrendous reviews and was extremely worried about our stay. We had decided to book a cheaper hotel so that we could spend our money on great restaurants and clubs and were worried that we had made a huge mistake. However, once we got to the hotel we were beyond pleasantly surprised. I had called the day before to ensure that we had a non-smoking room, and they upgraded s to a king bed for the same price. The room was HUGE - anyone on here complaining about the room size has either never stayed in a NYC hotel or apartment. The room was about the size of two of my bedrooms when I lived in NYC. It was clean and the bed was really comfortable. The air conditioning worked extremely well and was quiet, and they provided excellent maid service everyday. This is a no frills hotel - but everything was clean and comfortable - perfect for the amount of time we spent in our room (just to sleep!). The only downside we experienced was the elevators, which are old and a little scary - think OLD hotels in Europe. If you are afraid of elevators, I would request a low floor so you can use the stairs. We were able to leave our baggage there all day when we checked out and the staff was beyond friendly and accommodating. The location is ideal if you want a real NYC experience - I lived about 10 blocks from the hotel when I lived in NYC, and the Upper West Side is a GREAT neighborhood of bars and restaurants. The subway is a block away, use it! And Saigon Grill, one of my favorite restaurants in the city, is just off 91st and Amsterdam, about a 5 minute walk. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend that knew that a hotel in NYC is just to sleep in and that wanted a good deal. The

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional and risky”
Reviews.Author: Milestogo59
Reviews.Content: I just read a review from another member with a surprisingly similar experience. My family and I confirmed our two-day reservation with Days Broadway two days before our scheduled arrival. At that time I was told that the room was fully paid, and I was given information about location and parking. Upon arrival, I was told that there was no reservation and that the hotel was fully booked for the night - we were left stranded in NYC at 8PM without a place to stay! Fortunately, we were able to find a tiny room at the nearby Newton for $230 for one night (they were booked up the second night) and then a room at the Alexander for the second night. The employees at Days Broadway were unprofessional, cold, and rude. Even though the Newton and Alexander are far from ideal, they are both superior to this hotel. Not every hotel affiliated itself with 1-800-Hotels, but since this one did, it had an obligation to either communicate with its guests about a reservation problem or to provide a room!

Reviews.Title: “Bed to sleep in.”
Reviews.Author: happy35i
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 11:00pm. Using the elevator was a scary experience, hallways were cramped, room had the faint odor of urine, and I dare not touch the ground in the room or bathroom with my bare feet. In fact, I dare not touch anything in the room with any part of my body with the exception of the bedsheets. Free WiFi ONLY in the hotel lobby. Yet all these things are forgivable because this place had the best rate per night in Manhattan. The bed was clean, king sized, and they had lots of fluffy pillows. Sleep was excellent, shower was clean, was out the next day by 9:00am. Call ahead of time for information on parking.

Reviews.Title: “they denied we had a reservation-even with confirmation number”
Reviews.Author: sossityFtWorth
Reviews.Content: we booked through 800-hotels, but called the actual hotel twice to speak with the front desk, once to confirm reservation{made in june} and once to verify that if our plane arrived late checking in would not be a problem. They said both were ok. They lied. We got to NY and at the desk, miriam looked puzzled, said she could not find our reservation, and I showed her our printed confirmation, which was also paid in full. She said she would check with the manager{it turned out that the manager was not even in, some other person in the back was the checker.} They came back after 10 minutes and said that they had had the same problem with several other guests that day-the the 800-hotels people were going out of business and had cancelled our reservations. They gave me a type piece of paper which said this. They had supposedly had this info for several days, but never told us when we called, nor did they call us to tell us of the problem. So there we were late on a Friday night in NYC, hot and tired with no where to stay. They said they could give us their :last room" for almost twice our previous rate, for one night only. They were extremely uncaring, and not very helpful at all. Miriam seemed slightly amused. We were able to immediately book at a hotel/hostel down the street for the next nights, so it has seemed to have ended ok, with no help from the days hotel staff or the days inn company people we called. About the room--it was clean, smelled odd, and my allergies kicked in when we were in there{coughing, runny nose, itchy eyes} and i felt much better as soon as i went to the lobby, out to dinner, etc.} I would NOT recommend this hotel due to their unhelpful nature. They could have held rooms for people and assisted them when this occurred, called them to notify them, or in some way acted like they cared.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Stellabrilliante
Reviews.Content: Very concerned about staying at this motel after reading several negative reviews. However, we were pleasantly surprised! The location is excellent, being across the road from the subway. Great bakery and fruit vendor across the road and supermarket one block away.. Room was a little on the small side, but very clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Bathroom also small but very clean and renovated. Air conditioning excellent and whisper quiet. The staff were most helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bad News!”
Reviews.Author: Allforservice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is falling apart. If you decide to stay here, despite all the warnings on Trip Advisor--like I did--be prepared to be frustrated. I stayed here because I have been traveling for a while and wanted save a bit, but it really is not worth it. In my room, they had to fix the a/c, the internet, and the safety box before I could use any of them; I could only find one ice machine in the hotel that worked; and at the fitness center, not a single machine worked. Like another reviewer mentioned, the carpet in the room is so dirty that you must wear slippers at all times; there is no way you can walk on it bare foot. Seriously, this is the kind of place where you expect to see rodents. But worst of all, whenever I'm in the room, I get some allergic reaction: I start sneezing and my eyes start watering. So for me, it's not that it's no-frills, but it really is a health issue. For the same money, or less, you _can_ find a place in NY that is clean. Try, for example, http://www.airbnb.com/travel/new-york/ny.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but good hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: NewYorksGreatest
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful. Most of the staff is friendly. Location is not bad. Near a couple stores, banks, starbucks and so forth. Down falls: fitness center is made up of three machines 2 of which do not work. i was here for two nights, the first room i got was tiny, tvs are old with very limited channels. Breakfast is not included but your offered a discount at a place near by, tickets availible at the front desk. wifi in the first room was great, in the second room however (though the room was bigger0 wifi is slow. Over all the price is fair and the hotel is clean, though in both rooms the floors seemed to be sticky. Also right across the street from the 2 & the 1 train.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: amberone
Reviews.Content: all the plumbing was plugged! The tub was calf deep when taking a shower.you could not regulate the water temp and the fixtures were coming out of the wall!! the hotel said they were sold out and would have to rent the room to someone else and could not repair the problem terrible expierence.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basecamp For The Price”
Reviews.Author: thedailyguru
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights for both business and leisure during one of the most brutally hot stretch of days in all my many trips into New York City. I only state this because the A/C unit in my room was FANTASTIC and kept the room VERY cool. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and the hotel is just around the corner from the 96th Street subway station which services the 1, 2, and 3 lines, giving you easy access to the entire city. I was everywhere from down in Brooklyn to up in The Bronx, and the location of the hotel and proximity to the subway station served me quite well. Also, as the hotel is set in the Upper West Side, there is far less noise and such that one will find around Times Square. However, as has been stated in other reviews, there are many drawbacks to this hotel. Once you get out of the lobby, nearly everything is in need of a touch-up or replacement. Chipped paint, out-dated elevators, inconsistent water temp. in the shower, and the WIRELESS INTERNET WAS OUT. They said they were "between companies" and the only place you could get good internet service was in the lobby. Regardless, for me, as a single traveler who pretty much only needs a bed and internet and books more based on price and location than the aesthetic of the hotel, on my next trip back to NYC, I will likely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price and location in Manhattan -- just ok”
Reviews.Author: solaris_pete
Reviews.Content: The price was good for Upper Manhattan - close to cafes, some shops and Central Park. The location and price are the best selling points, the bed and washrooms are clean. But, unfortunately that's probably the best things about this hotel. The lobby looks nice, but elevator is small and dated. The carpets in the hallway needs some refresh, and the room hallways have a funny smell. Luckily our room's hallway facing the window was ok. Wifi is available but for two days I couldn't get it to work (and I am a SysAdmin myself!) Most of the staff are kind of rude and short. One or two were slightly accomodating. I wanted to leave the bags in secured area for few hours after check out, and wanted to make sure my laptop bag is secured. I told the lady "can you ensure it's secure since I have secure documents". She came back to me and said rudely, "so does every other customer have secured documents, it's safe". Well, for me, my company's stuff is in my laptop... She just assumes that I am being paranoid and like all other customers. I also heard other customers complaints during my stay, ice machine broken on 9th floor and clerk says, "then use the one on 5th and 11th if it's broken". Also, the staff hides behind the door, I rang the bell on desk, they finally came out and then took the bell and again hid it behind the sign on the desk... too funny... The price of the night's stay can't be beat, but you have to tolerate the hotel staff and condition of hotel. It does look like it needs some renovations and refresh. Beds are just ok, bathroom is relatively clean, floor is a bit uneven, carpets I wouldn't eat off of, Table a bit wobbly, A/C works but noisy and old. You get the idea. I wouldn't bring my family with kids here, but for just bunch of guys, that's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Upper upper east side”
Reviews.Author: 88travelbug
Reviews.Content: Walking wise it is Located quite far away from times square etc but located just less than a minutes walk to the subway station. Therefore you can easily get to anywhere in nyc with a short journey. used it everyday to get to and from the airport ($5.25 one way) times square, china town, the area where u board boats to get to the statue of liberty and single journeys cost 2 dollars or so. Room is clean, clean bed, clean bathroom. The shower takes a couple of minutes to heat up. Hairdryer was broken but they said if we needed one they would send one up. Iron and tv in room. Air con worked. Soap etc supplied. The room lacked sparkle and wow but it was still clean. I would consider staying there again as it was one of the cheaper hotels in newyork whilst booking at last minute. Do not expect this hotel to be plush and grand. A mix of people stayed at the hotel ranging from couples in their 60s to younger guests in their 20s. Felt safe in the area and in the hotel at all times. Located in a busy area with lots of restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, well managed clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CossyWombat
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience in another NY hotel it was a pleasant surprise to find this hotel on the upper east side of Manhattan. The rooms are well appointed clean and the room service is both daily and well done. Hotels in NYC are expensive but we found Days Hotel to be good value for money. The only criticism relates to the wireless internet which was sporadic at best. We are a family of 3 and took a suite and it was well worth while.

Reviews.Title: “great avalue”
Reviews.Author: Crakie
Reviews.Content: For the money just a great place to stay Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn good, if I may say so.”
Reviews.Author: MarcusSoares
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews, I wasn't expecting very much from this hotel. I only picked it because everything else was sold out. So I was quite surprised when I stepped inside. The lobby is quite small compared to most other hotels, but that's really not very important. There are two sets of elevators that can be used, and although you might have to wait a while for them to come, that really isn't something anybody should be complaining about. The door to my room was somewhat old, but it opened just fine. My room had a weird smell, but nothing nobody could get used to. Bathroom was clean, shower was good. The beds and carpeted floor were also clean, and the bugs I was expecting this hotel to have proved to be non-existant. My only complaint would be the room lacked certain plug outlets. The only two available plugs were in the "kitchen" section, which was quite far from the main desk. My laptop charger barely made it. The best thing about this hotel would be the location. Located on the corner of Broadway, with a Metro stop just 2 minutes away, you can stay in this hotel and basically go everywhere in Manhattan. If I were to go to New York City again, I'd definitely stay in this hotel, unless I managed to find a cheaper option.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get a cheaper price”
Reviews.Author: Cassakay
Reviews.Content: I paid $87.00 plus taxes through Priceline and was very satisfied. The Days Hotel is on the Upper West Side, at 94th St, just a two minute walk from the 2/3 subway station. I had the option of staying with friends in the city and was only going to stay in a hotel if I found the right price and comfort level, and the Days Hotel turned out to be perfect for this. It's like an Econo Lodge in a cooler building. The hotel is quiet (as much as it gets in Manhattan, though there will be noise anywhere in the city), clean, and comfortable. I ordered one room with a double bed and my companion and I were upgraded to a room with two doubles and hair dryer, probably because we came mid-week. The hotel room was bigger than any I've seen in the city before, with a small private bathroom that's reasonably large for the city. There was enough room to stand and dry off comfortably, which is more than I expected. There was also a walk-in closet that was definitely bigger than some of the bathroom or elevators I've been in in the city! The TV was a largish 90s box enclosed in a wardrobe, and we got cable and wireless Internet. You may have to have the front desk explain the wifi sign-on process to you, because I found it an unusual log-in process, but it did work. It was sluggish, but usable. It's an older building with non-standard design. It's a big of a maze to find your room and they don't seem to be square rooms. There's a vending machine on at least some of the floors. The hotel's in an active area with plenty of places to eat, drink, and socialize nearby and I felt safe venturing out late at night. The employees were friendly and efficient, if not particularly effusive (which I for one prefer). An information desk is located in the lobby if you're a first-time tourist and would like some help on what to see and do and how to get there. There was an interesting mix of families and foreign tourists at the hotel, and some common areas so it seems like you could meet people if you wished to. There's a business center, as well, though I'm not sure what services it offers. When I asked about a take-out place nearby, I got directed to a diner around the corner that is definitely charging sit-down prices I'd say were fair but not good, and I especially didn't want to take out from there. If you're not looking to blow your money at every meal, scout around a bit to find somewhere cheaper. There's a Europa Cafe down two blocks that's reasonably priced for take-out (around 5-7$ for a made-to-order sandwich or breakfast) and a pizza place one block over and two blocks down that charges about two or three dollars for surprisingly good New York slice, called Famous Famiglia. When you're tired and cranky from arriving, I'd recommend that. Take a left when you leave the door of the hotel, turn left at the corner onto Amsterdam Avenue, and it's number 734 on the left a block or two down. All in all, I'm glad I stayed here, and I'd do it again if I wanted a night back in the city without imposing on friends. This was I got privacy, comfort, and convenience for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good hotel if you are...”
Reviews.Author: Rozza-118
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel if you are staying for a city break or short holiday. We stayed in a family room which was spacious and clean. It is very near a subway stop and 30 second walk from a duane reade (a spar/pharmacy/corner shop). If you don't like lifts then make sure you walk down to the lobby the lift is small loud and squeeky!!!! But a very good cheap stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you are traveling on a bugdet”
Reviews.Author: mynetreviewstv
Reviews.Content: My recommendations are: Make sure they have changed the sheets on bed before you sleep. (even on your first day there) Other than that, it is all fine. It is not a fancy hotel and it is not worthy more than $85 a night, sometimes they even try to charge $133, don't pay all that or you ll be frustrated. The subway is one block away, so you can go anywhere fast. There is a restaurant two blocks away called Famiglia, they have the best pizza and best ever lasagna. It is clean, safe. you get what you pay for. I stayed there for a week...

Reviews.Title: “Had a terrible experience and we didn't even get there yet!”
Reviews.Author: gracious94
Reviews.Content: I booked a short stay at this hotel for myself and a friend since I had to be in NYC to do an interview for a visa. Our trouble started as soon as we booked the trip online. While I wrote my name and e-mail into the form, when the booking went through the confirmation page booked it under my dad's name (since he signed in under his name, I guess). Okay, fine. I'll just call in and change the name on the reservation. You wouldn't believe the run-around I had just to make a simple first-name change. After speaking to different people for 30+ minutes who have NO CLUE and constantly transferred me to other people, someone magically knew how to help me after I started yelling at them. Fast forward to the week of the stay. I call to warn that the credit card owner will not be traveling. Here we go again. Except, they knew how to help me this time... the solution to the "problem" depended on the person I was talking to! Never mind that the name on the reservation STILL HASN'T BEEN CHANGED after they assured me that it was! They tried to give me the run around on that one again but this time I was not having it. Back to the credit card. Different people kept telling me different things on what to do. One of them told me to just receive a fax, fill it out and send it back. I don't have a fax machine in my house, so I ask if we can receive an e-mail, write a letter or do something else. I get transferred again. Then the next guy can't hear me, and I mysteriously get disconnected. Forget it. I promptly canceled the reservation. The customer service is terrible and I would NOT recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Subway and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lisanmike6
Reviews.Content: Not a newer hotel but what you would expect at this price. Clean and roomy with friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Micklefielder
Reviews.Content: For what I paid I could have stayed in a midtown hotel. Nonetheless, it did its job. As far as the location, it's a bit out of the way if you want to see all of the attractions, although it's only a short walk to the park. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, but it's a good ten minute walk to the lively bars on Amsterdam Avenue. The room was a bit small compared to what we've been used to, but it was okay. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, although the cleaning staff were a bit noisy in the corridors on a morning, which might not have gone down too well with anyone nursing a hangover. Even so, I quite enjoyed my stay at this hotel and in The Upper West Side area. This might not be the ideal location for everyone. However, for anyone that wishes to escape the tourist atmosphere of the midtown area and experience a bit more of what Manhattan has to offer it does have its advantages.On the whole, not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Textbook demonstration of how to ruin a weekend”
Reviews.Author: UpperWestSider007
Reviews.Content: I live nearby, and had friends who'd come to visit and had nice things to say about this hotel & their stay. Booked a room for them in person at their front desk for ~$150/night, two nights, prepaid; the desk clerk understood that my dad was NOT to receive the bill or receipt, this was a gift to him. My folks arrived, no reservation in my name or in theirs; I had to go over in person with my card to restore the reservation. The beds were not made, though the bedspreads were fully pulled up and neat, there were no towels in the bathroom. Phoned down a request for sheets & towels, and for hangers for the closet (there were none), to the desk, and 45 minutes later went down myself to ask for them. Over an hour after that (past midnight at this point) they showed up and made the beds, laid out the bathroom, and dropped a half-dozen hangers on the bed. The hangers had the little knobs on the end, and the closet had a conventional rail, so the hangers were useless. Phoned down to the desk, waited... No apology, no nothing. The room was tiny, and did not smell like the promised non-smoking room. Getting out of the bed on one side meant executing a very close mince step to avoid stepping on an uninsulated hot water pipe running to the radiator; dad scalded his foot rather badly in the middle of the night. One lamp didn't work at all, until we figured out it was unplugged, and it was unplugged because the switch was broken and that was the only way to turn the light off. In plugging in the lamp it was determined that vacuuming was done on visible areas of the carpets only. The kicker? My folks when checking out were handed the receipt from the desk clerk; my card had been charged $400 per night, the sum I'd evidently signed to when I made my reservation "on the internet".

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic, poor room service!”
Reviews.Author: reckless_traveler
Reviews.Content: Was here for 2 night with my folks. The good thing about this place is it is close to Central Park, Times Square, the Empire State etc and plenty of restaurants near by. But this place is like a pigeon-house. Claustrophobic people keep-off! The pillars on each floor leaves very little space for people to walk along in the corridors. I would think some fat people may not be able to walk freely in the corridors! The rooms weren't spacious either! For 128$/night, I hoped for something better! Room service didn't show up, they lied to the front desk saying we had a "do not disturb" sign out! They couldn't find anyone else to do it and so all I could get was fresh towels and toiletries. Didn't have a problem with the staff, they were okay. They claimed to have wireless internet, but they probably meant some 10 bytes per second connectivity. I couldn't browse any (#*#*&#(*$(! Will never stay here again and certainly would recommend others to KEEP OFF!

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, safe”
Reviews.Author: ptrbrtt
Reviews.Content: I was going to stay in a private building at 57 east 82nd, by a strange lowballing owner who had a decent place, but never said he wanted to jack up the price from 75 dollars to 200 with a 200 dollar deposit. So there I was, needed a temporary place to stay. Ended up there. Sure, the front desk fellow wasnt some beautiful woman as a fashionable hotel, but he gave me his word the rooms were clean. So I pay 103 dollars, no security deposit, etc. He told me to use the eastern elevator which was too tight to get the cart in (no bellman at that hour), so I used the other elevator which was big. On the way to my room there was a potatoe chip wrapper in the hallway. But the room was clean, the bathroom was clean, the room was warm on the cold night, it had a decent amount of space. Sure, it wasnt fancy, it was no frills, but it was decent, safe, quiet, clean, and clean, within the room and

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JuliaSays
Reviews.Content: We had no expectations from a hotel other than a place to sleep. The Days Hotel was great for our budget, and was very clean. There is a subway stop just across the street, and a Grey Line stop around the corner, making transportation very convenient. Central Park is an easy walk down the street. The elevators in the building were tiny.

Reviews.Title: “As expected, No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Dunsworth
Reviews.Content: My husband an I read a lot of hotel reviews before we booked this hotel. The price was reasonable, and Days Inn is a chain, so we felt safe with the name. The staff was friendly. I called the front desk and asked if they had a vending machine (they had 2) but the guy recommended going to the little store on the corner because the prices were comparable and the selection was better. We got a room with a double bed. It was very huge, almost filled the whole room. There was also an armoire with a TV, a desk and a fridge. If you had large luggage and wanted to spread out. then I can imagine it would be cramped. But for the two of us it was perfect. The bathroom was clean and stocked. But, it kind of smelled like curry and I thought the towels smelled smoky (but my husband didn't smell anything). The heater worked great, it was nice and toasty. In fact, we turned on the A/C to sleep. Our room faced Broadway, and other reviewers complained about the street noise, but our A/C was all we heard. Only downer - the hallways were really narrow and the elevators barely fit 4 people. Near by the hotel there are lots of restaurants and a Duane Read (CVS like place). We at at "Texas BBQ", which has a wide variety of food. And "Peaches Yogurt" where I had green tea custard and my husband had a smoothie. They also served waffles and crepes/. The best part about the location of the hotel was that it is only 2 blocks from a subway station. The subway is super cheap and fairly easy to navigate if you know where you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DreamCyn
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, after reading all the up and down reviews about this place I was terrified! I was expecting a run-down flea-bitten roach-invested hell hole! But for about $80/night on the Upper West Side, I couldn't afford anything else on the island. I was, by all accounts, terrified. But, really, it was nothing like that. Is it a four star Marriott with all the luxuries and high-style life? No... but is it awful? No. It was okay. Simple as that. It was adequate. And for the location and value, it was fantastic. Especially since it is New York, and we were only in the room for a few hours every night anyway. We had no problems with the staff; they let us drop our bags off before check-in (then let us check in early a few hours later), and were completely helpful and friendly despite our early early (4:20am) check-out and even reserved a cab for us to make sure we got to the airport on time. Our room on the 11th floor was pretty big and completely clean. It's a little run down, but with no real problems. The first thing I did when we got into our room was check the bed for bedbugs. Not one! The bed was just fine, nothing great but comfortable anyway. The room was a good size, especially for NYC, and there was even a closet if we'd needed the storage space. The tv had a very limited selection of channels, but we only watched like once anyway. WiFi worked just fine. The bathroom was clean enough. There were tiny specks of mold in the tiles, but nothing gross. The shower was a bit of an adventure though. It took forever to heat up and when it did, the water was waaay too hot. But with a little patience and adjusting I got it to work well enough. The neighborhood was good, we never felt unsafe walking home at night, and there was a Fantastic sushi place right across the street. Decently affordable and so delicious! Subway was barely a block over, and there are so many places to eat on Broadway! I did notice one or two people who obviously lived there. A little weird, but they weren't creepy or gross or anything, just odd. For the location and price, I'll definitely consider this place the next time we plan a visit to the big apple. I've paid a lot more money for a lot less here in the small towns of NC, this was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with easy access to Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: flcitizen
Reviews.Content: After staying in a poor hotel at JFK airport in order to attend a business conference, I moved to this hotel in Manhattan just west of Central Park. I was pleased with my room; it was clean with a comfortable bed and a nice bathroom. Staff was professional, helpful and polite; a far cry from the previous hotel. Subway station at 96th St. had direct subway 1 to Columbus square, Times Square and theaters. Good bagel shop and pizza shops at Broadway and 97th. Great value for a great location. I'd stay there again without hesitation. My room was small and just right for me. If you want to use Wyndham Rewards, book directly with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Visit the REAL New York”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideJoan
Reviews.Content: Anyone expecting the Taj Mahal would be disappointed. However, for the price it was excellent value. Fabulous part of New York - where the real New Yorkers live. Subway will quickly take you to all the hot spots. Central Park nearby. Hop on Hop Off Tours have a stop practically at the front door of the hotel. Bathroom was clean and hot water always available. Room was a bit tacky, but clean enough and the beds were exceptionally comfortable. Air conditioner in the room worked a treat. Contrary to other reports, I found it very quiet. Restaurants, shops etc all at the door. Eating out was fabulous. Nice places to go and get coffee before returning to the hotel to sleep. Staff at the hotel were very helpful, friendly and polite. As long as you're not expecting a luxury hotel, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Taffy Derek
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the net and after we did so we read a few very disturbing reports. We got worried. Why we did we have no idea. This hotel although with a few people actualy living in the hotel full time and dominating the lifts, we had a very pleasant stay. we would recomend it to anyone. Staff very good. Travel desk couldn't do enough for us. The bagage men very friendly indeed. Again couldn't do enough for us. Bedroom and bathroom very clean indeed, the only thing that could have been done to improve it was that the carpet could do with a clean. Very good value for money very glad we stayed there. Why someone would book a five star hotelat the prices they charge we have no idea The Johnsons from New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “Does the basics well”
Reviews.Author: Snarky
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel, and while it has its flaws, it was convenient to seeing Manhattan and we got a good night's sleep every night. Location: The hotel is on 94th Street, a few steps off of Broadway. There's an entrance to the subway in front of the bodega ("94th Street Blueberry Farm") across 94th from the hotel. Most of the prime tourist action is around Times Square, which you'd take a downtown train to get there. You have two choices: if you pick the express side of the platform, you're there in two stops, and it's very convenient. If you pick the local side, you'll still get there, but you will stop every couple of blocks. Pretty much every subway line connects at Times Square and that gets you anywhere in the city, so once you remember to take the express train to Times Square, you'll love this hotel and understand why they say that they're close to all the action. The Surrounding Neighborhood: You're blocks from Central Park, so if the weather is nice, grab your camera and take a walk. Turn left out of the hotel. You'll cross Amsterdam, Columbus, and then you'll be at Central Park West and the park will be across the street. We entered the park at 96th and Central Park West and found ourselves in the North Meadow, which is used for youth soccer games. There's also jogging trails, a nice children's playground, and benches to sit down and take a break. There are some nice places to eat off of Amsterdam, and some friendly pubs to grab a drink that are reasonably priced. One of New York's iconic deli's, Barney Greengrass, is within walking distance. It's not cheap, but if you want a real Jewish deli and not a "concept" restaurant, it's worth walking over for breakfast or lunch. (You'll also find a cheaper deli on Broadway with a good breakfast if you turn right out of the hotel and walk about a block past the Duane Reade.) If you grow tired of paying too much for a hamburger around Times Square and want to spend an evening living like a local, you're staying in a pretty nice residential neighborhood, so you have the option of hanging out with New Yorkers. The hotel itself: As with most New York hotels, the building is old and the elevators are tiny and slow. (I found the same size elevator at the Marriott East Side. The difference is that the Marriott's elevator looks nice inside and the Days Inn looks like someone went to Home Depot, grabbed some cheap plastic that you might use to line a bathroom wall and lined the elevator with it.) The carpet needs to be replaced. If you're in a room across from the ice machine (we were) you're going to hear noise. However, the important basic stuff is A-OK. The bed was comfortable, the pillows were thick and supportive, and hot water was never a problem. There is free WiFi. I couldn't get my phone to connect to the WiFi, but I did see people in the lobby with their laptops, so it did work for some people. There is a business center where you can pay by the minute to use a computer. You will pay for all phone calls, even 800 numbers. There is a tour desk where they'll hook you up with sightseeing or airport shuttles, although I opted to skip that because I've been to the city enough to know where I'm going (or use HopStop to tell me how to get there). All in all, we got a great night's sleep every night, and while we were underwhelmed when we first walked in, we had a great trip and really couldn't complain about the hotel and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem for the price”
Reviews.Author: carcol29
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel to stay at when you can't afford anything else closer to midtown. I even found parking on the same street (since there is alot of residence there), I just had to make sure it wasn't street cleaning time. There are plenty of garage for parking around but I didn't have to pay for it since my timing was good with the street cleaning. The hotel itself is old but it's clean. Everything was working and clean. Just don't look under the bed because I found a mouse trap! It didn't give me a good feeling after I saw it but I did see it on my last day there....besides, I rather see a mouse trap than a mouse itself (which there was no signs of). They first gave me a smoking room by accident, which is located out in the halls....the smell was just aweful so I quickly waited for a non smoking room. The staff is really friendly. I did not feel unsafe around the area at all....everything is well lit and plenty of people around. I had a room on the same side of the street and I did not find it loud at night. There is a great little diner downstairs (just 2 doors away) and right next to the hotel is a Duane Reade which is open 24/7 and has everything you need, even food! The stations are a few blocks away. I totally recommend this. You can't expect much since it is a really old building (it ain't the Waldorf but it is good enough for me ) but I would go back if I can't find anything else thats the same price or cheaper. I would prefer to be closer to midtown but this price was great for a weekend in the city (paid approx. $80 per night). Central Park is just two avenues away. I stayed there a weekend to go to Yankee Stadium. It was easy to get to the subway and back. Plenty of restaurants and bars a few blocks away. I did see all types of people staying at this hotel: foreigners, locals (like me), all different races, young college kids, families, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Jennyfer62
Reviews.Content: This is where I will be staying next time I visit Manhattan. Wonderful staf and very nice room. Great location to the subway and that is the absolute best way to get around. I have stayed at other hotels on Manhattan but this hotel is where I will be staying again. The bed was big and comfortable and the room big. The bathroom in very fine condition. The staff was wonderful and very helpful always with a smile on their face. I couldn´t be more satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but dated, not as close to Times Square as stated but safe area.”
Reviews.Author: pinkladytracy
Reviews.Content: I was petrified about going to this hotel after reading all then reports on here, from clean to bed bugs and creaky lifts. It was our first time in NY and i really thought i was going to a borstal. plesaed with reception which was nicely decorated if a little dated. The staff were okay, i requested a low floor after hearing about the creaky lifts, and when we got there they had put me on 11th floor, after arguing with a lady who said she had nothing else the manager came over and told me i could be on 2nd floor - thank god, as my husbanc used the lifts and they were very scary - rickety, unreliable and very small! room was clean - no bed bugs but i did pull off the dodgy looking blanket, room had 2 queen beds which were very comfortbale. The carpet was very sticky so i wore sandals or socks the whole, time bathroom was clean but small and we had no view - it was barred up and was next to another hotel. but as someone said on here - YOU DONT go to NY to stay in the hotel, we were hardly in there only just to sleep for a few hours and set off again. Id say the rooms reminded me of a B&B in blackpool. The location was safe and clean very close to Broadway but as broadway is the longest road in NY stretching almost full length this doesnt help. IT IS NOT NEAR times sqaure even thoguh that was what was stated. It was $10 in a taxi, but a subway is close by and a few blocks from top of central park, so can walk - but did take us hours. Would i stay again - no, id wana be closer to Times Square but for cheapness and its in Manhatten then i would recommed it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in NY”
Reviews.Author: activetraveller18
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling in hotels in NY and ended up staying here as all other hotels in Manhattan were sold out. One of the worst hotels ever - the room that I got could not be located as there were no signs for the rooms. Finally, I had to go down and the manager told me that the room was located in the staircase area. Terrible, smelly rooms, rickety lifts - they claimed to have free wireless but it was so slow that it was good as useless. No provision for breakfast either - for the money I spent, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location... great value.”
Reviews.Author: drayy
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, but the carpeting and furnishings had seen better "days." Inexpensive and located within a block of the subway. Some of the elevators were being repaired the entire time we were there, which meant we had to wait 15 minutes or more for an elevator. The only complaint is that we had to go into the hall to get a decent WiFi signal. That was a nuisance. The hotel next door has a stronger signal. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: sirberk
Reviews.Content: My first review on trip advisor. Just wanted to warn about this hotel. I was woken up at 4AM with bedbug bites and observed the bedbugs in my bed. Room was also rather dingy and dirty. Not a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rollypr
Reviews.Content: We went for 4 days we have no complains, just the soda machine at my 4th floor was not working but its many places to get drinks & more. Room very neat ,clean & big bathroom. Subway Station at the corner, also a pharmacy downstairs. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my first trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: JaceChel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and was great. Room was on the 5th floor. Room and separate living room and bedroom. Room was larger that what I expected. Very clean room. 2 TVs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Bathroom connected with the bedroom. Furniture were in decent condition. Carpet and flooring very clean. View wasn't that great...but that was ok. Friendly front desk. Housekeeping excellent. I would come back and stay. Great diner next to the hotel...a must see...

Reviews.Title: “though like a wanderer . . . darkness be over me . . . my rest a stone”
Reviews.Author: rickrub
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of those "only in New York" kind of places; barely adequate, generally. Room was clean - refrigerator worked; bathroom OK - had a nice view north to the east end of the nave and the crossing of Cathedral of St. John the Divine. There were safety issues, however. Door on street is open ALL NIGHT 24/7. ANYONE can enter the hotel; be sure to keep door to room locked when inside. Two of the major elevators were BROKEN FOR WEEKS. But, one does not travel to NYC to spend very much time in hotel rooms. If you don't mind the consistent bad situations I mentioned, then by all means, stay here. It's very convenient to subway (Broadway IRT), taxis, delis, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel I have ever stayed at! A HORRIBLE experience :(”
Reviews.Author: Nolababe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a true nigthmare. We booked this hotel last minute for a graduation and we liked the location. When we arrived, we checked in and went to our room. The room was dark, dingy, with old nasty carpet and a nasty smell to it. The mini fridge in the room was broken. After taking showers to freshen up (the showers had low pressure and not great). We decided to deal with the room and just enjoy the city. The location of the hotel was the only thing about this hotel that is a plus. Right in the Upper West Side at Broadway and right next to the subway. We arrived back to our room late at night and got ready for bed.......and this is when the real disaster begins. The toilet started overflowing and overflowing and overflowing, we could NOT get it to stop, it took up the entire bathroom and room (several inches of water), we kept on calling the front desk, who kept on saying "our cleaning and maintenance people are gone for the day, so why don't you call back tomorrow." We finally went downstairs and stated that we could not walk in our room, since the entire floor was flooded, they offered us towels and told us we need to clean up the excess water in the room, so that it does not spread to the downstairs room. We insisted we needed help, and this was no fix the problem with a few towels matter, they downgraded us to a smaller room, which was even nastier and dustier. The next day, we spoke with the manager about our issues, and how we had our feet in several inches of feces contaminated water, and how no one would lend us a hand, and we had to practically force them to give us a new room, and he offered no apology and no compensation. We had pre-payed for 3 nights and wanted to get a refund for the remaining 2 nights, so that we could go stay someplace decent and clean (without feces and toilet water floating around), and of course, he refused. So were forced to stay in our smaller, downgraded room for the next 2 nights. Lucky for us, we love Manhattan, and we spend lots of time in the city and took advantage of the loation of the nasty hotel and barely set foot in the hotel, other than to get some minimal sleep. After this experience we will only stay at hotels with a solid 4 star rating, and we will be sure to read reviews on tripadvisor before we book a room. Our mistake for just blindly booking with today's internet resources available. We still managed to have a great time in NYC, but the Days Hotel is a filthy dump, with nasty carpet, and dirty interiors and a horrible plumming system (I met people in the lobby who had toilet issues as well), and the manager who is also likely the owner is as real jerk, who would not even think of helping or doing the bare minimum to satisfy his customers NEVER EVER EVER EVER AGAIN!!!! NASTIEST HOTEL EVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Has had better 'days'”
Reviews.Author: ped_gardner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Days Hotel, 14 to 17 April 09, inclusive, allocated there by JetlineCruises.com. after a six day Atlantic crossing on Queen Mary 2 (which was fabulous). Days Hotel has probably had better 'days'. Room was dark and tired. However, bed linen and bathroom towels were spotless. Located upper west side of New York. Had we known better would have asked for a hotel more central. The extra cost of somewhere more central would have been have been covered by what we paid out in taxi fares to and from hotel. For anyone on a very tight buget the hotel would probably be ok. On two positive points there is a great dinner, 'New Key West', just around the corner. Had breakfast and late dinner there both nights. much cheaper than eating in central New York. The quality and quantity of food was excellent. The staff had a good laugh as we struggled with the quantity. The other good point was that Central Park was within walking distance. This was our first visit to New York and we had a great time, but would have chosen a better hotel, if it had not been for the hotel being part of a package. Jetline could have done a better job with their explanation of the hotel and its location. Pete & Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryCornwall
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one week and it was just awful! There were cockroaches in our room and we were on the 12th floor! The place must have been plagued with the things. I even found one floating in the coffee! The staff were unhelpful and the lifts were awful. Calling it the Quality Hotel is a complete farce. Fawlty Towers would be more apt. It reminded us of some cruddy Youth Hostel in a third world country. It ruined our visit to New York and we couldn't wait to leave and go home. It is, without any doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I would gladly have paid more to stay in something decent but that will teach me to trust a travel agent, never again! I agree with the person who said take your tent and put it up in Central Park, you'll be much more comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jsohmer
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was scared of coming here. However,my room ( smoking - eleventh floor) although small, was clean and comfortable. I had a good kingsize bed, and the bathroom was clean and functional.The elevator was slow and clunky,but it got me to my floor.The subway was only across the street.The service at the front desk was affable enough.I got this hotel on Hotwire, and I would certaily give this hotel another try/

Reviews.Title: “not good, not good at all”
Reviews.Author: chillinnn
Reviews.Content: We went there and read their notice about how "everything works" when nothing in our room worked..the toliet didn't even flush! so we told the very unhelpful staff who didn't get anything done till the third time we asked them. By then it was our last night and still had many problems with other broken things in the room. In addition they need to sort out their heating systems.. mwhahaha basically dont go there to save yourself from a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near subway, diner and drug store”
Reviews.Author: shefftrip
Reviews.Content: The room we had for four was like two separate rooms with a shared bathroom. Own fridge, tvs, safe and clean sheets and towels every day. Definitely no bed bugs (I checked thoroughly) and an excellent base for a budget stay in the Big Apple. If you worry about slightly worn carpets then I think you need to get out more! Why stay in your room when you're in the city that never sleeps? Great diner - the Key West literally under the hotel. Only two blocks from the subway and serviced on Broadway by reliable buses that take you downtown to the sites. Walkable to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean!!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaOLeary
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend were in New York last November 2008 and booked the Days Broadway Hotel through Gullivers Travel for €201.50 each for four nights, we were a little anxious about the hotel as we had booked the Pennsylvannia Hotel, however after reading the reviews cancelled immediatly and booked the Days Broadway. We had absolutely no reason to be concerned, the Days Broadway Hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms are a little small, but served their purpose as we were there to shop and enjoy the nightlife, we just wanted somewhere clean and quiet with working facilities. As the hotel is located at 96th Street Subway Station, it's a little far from the attractions of Manhattan, however we had no problems with the subway and it only cost $2.00 per trip. I would definitely go back to the Days Broadway hotel and would reccommend it to my friends and family, the staff were very helpful and polite which made our experience of New York even better!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a disgrace - rated 2.5 star - more like -2.5 star”
Reviews.Author: AngryTripper
Reviews.Content: I went to New York as a birthday surprise with my husband and young son. We were aware that the hotel was advertised as a 2.5 star hotel, and as we had travelled to the US many times before, we knew that although basic, the hotels were generally very well kept. This one was not - The room was freezing although the 'radiator' was on full. We had to go to bed almost fully clothed to keep warm. We stayed the first night as we didn't arrive there until the evening. Wallpaper was dirty and in some places peeling away from the walls. The windows were taped up with gaffer tape and in some places where the gaps were too big, there was foam material wedged into the gaps. The heating made a gushing noise all night, there was steam and water coming from the valve and dripping onto the carpet. T The furniture was falling to bits and the only chair in the room was so worn it had ripped and the stuffing was showing. The lift was something else - it was like an old service lift from the 30's. I could go on ... I would advise anyone NOT to stay at this hotel. It is in need of complete refurbishment, and certainly is not as the photos on the website lead you to believe. Nancy Wright London, UK

Reviews.Title: “Not bad in context with the rest of NYC accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 7RufusG
Reviews.Content: The hours scouring the net for reasonable accommodation in NYC I won't get back. With a heavy heart I reluctantly plumped for this hotel as being the best of a bad bunch. The other options were either too awkward location wise or ridiculously expensive. Taking the still-too-high costs out of the equation for now the hotel is tired but I found the staff and the room to be adequate. All the staff I had contact with were courteous and helpful - although I didn't have any pressing issues to test that with - and the room size/condition/cleanliness ok for the obvious high turnover of occupants. The location of the hotel was pretty darned good, as others have said, several subways close by taking you main-line into the very centre in just a couple of stops. Central Park is easily accessible on foot as were reasonable restaurants/bars. Back to the room - the decor is tired but I the room was always made up well during the day with coffee and a snack left on the side. Cost. This is something I was totally unprepared for, especially 'out of season'. My head isn't in the clouds when it comes to matters like that and of course expected NYC accommodation cost to be 'enhanced' but certainly not to that extent. Central London is positively cheap in comparison. However, I was staying in NYC so had to pay the going rate. Overall I got a reasonable deal for NYC and referring specifically to that hotel I found holding off placing my booking until about a week before travel and then purchasing the non-refundable/changeable option to be MUCH better value. Obviously I wouldn't necessarily recommend doing that in high season but it worked for me in that instance. You could do much worse than stay here, believe me!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: miss_elle_woods
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the not-so-choice reviews of this hotel, I was somewhat concerned about what to expect. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Ok, so it isn't the Waldorf Astoria, but how much can one expect for such a reasonable price, in NYC terms at least. I arrived earlier than planned at 2pm, but my room was ready and I was able to check in straight away. The room was a reasonable size by NYC standards, but small of course by other standards, but as a seasoned NYC traveller I was impressed by the larger-than-expected size of the room. The good: clean, easy location (subway on the corner) so felt safe as a single woman, nice enough rooms, not too noisy even though I was facing out to the street.
