The bad: Only one small radiator under the window didn't really provide enough warmth for NYC in December. The lift really was an experience to behold - I walked every time after trying it once!

Reviews.Title: “Just Off Broadway in New York”
Reviews.Author: ghostguy
Reviews.Content: Getting a non-refundable early reservation saved us some money and we got very good value in return. Hotel is very convenient to all the sites and venues in NYC, just off Broadway and close to the uptown/downtown 7th Avenue route. Rooms were very quiet and clean. Our only complaint during our stay is that the blanket (though clean) was old and had several holes in it. That takes the romance out of it if you spot those. Check in and out was easy. Free newspaper daily and coffee/snack in room. Many restaurants close by. Desk staff was superbly helpful in our planning and very courteous. A nice stay and we'll go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on 94th and broadway at the days hotel”
Reviews.Author: madison121
Reviews.Content: Well lets start off by saying When I arrived at the hotel I was told by the front office mananger My reservations were not found She said call central reservations and get me the reservation # ,By the way she should not be the front office mananger ,she is rude and has no customer service skills , SHe was dressed like she worked at A store jeans and sweater and boots, She is just a unhappy nasty person, Finally after 1 hour going back and forth I got my reservation # and they put it in there system I cant understand if i book at 1800 days inn why would my reservation not be there . Thats only the start I went up to my room thats why its so cheap there carpet stained there was actually bubble gum stuck to the carpet and burns as well this was a non smoking room how can it have burns furniture was broke TV didnt work and the heat made this strange noise The heat is old fashioned it s a radiator on the wall you cant ajust how hot you want it and the room went from cold to hot and the room was in a stairway all by its self didnt want to stay in that room went to the front desk to ask to be moved to a different room they upgraded me to a king bed from a double this room was worse then the first one i had They should be shut down or remodle and have some new management staff in there Would not stay there again its a nasty dirty place with rude management There is actually people who live here on a regular basis it used to be a shelter for low income people It has a laundry mat in it never saw a hotel with that i went past it and the people who live there wer doing there wash THIS PLACE IS NOT WORTH IT AND IF YOU STAY HERE STAY FAR AWAY FROM THE FRONT OFFICE MANANGER SHE IS NASTY

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Newry82
Reviews.Content: This hotel whilst not outstanding ticks the respective boxes for somewhere to stay on a budget in New York. Its location is fine only a short ride on the subway to all the main attractions and the staff were helpful when required. Yes the rooms maybe could do with alick of paint but other than that i thoroughly enjoyed my stay. However be careful when using the lift as it is an experience to behold.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people, great location! Do it!”
Reviews.Author: 100beachbums
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from 4 days in this hotel (2 adults 1 teen). Budget travel, and Upper West Side for $179 wkend and $110 wkdays, it was a BARGAIN! Get room 1103 -- its HUGE! 2 beds, with plenty of room to walk around. Beds were OK -- not plush, but we all slept well. 4 pillows per bed! Bath and linens were clean. Carpet needs replacing, so we got extra towels and made a pathway on the floor, took our shoes off and walked on the towels. (Forgot my disposable flip flops... suggest bringing some so you don't worry about what your feet are touching.) Room cleanliness = 2.5-3 (everything considered). Bed cleanliness 4 (pulled the spread off -- I always do), bathroom cleanliness 3 (tub mat was pretty stained). Water was warm enough -- not steaming, but not cold. Need to remove the carpeting and just tile, and dust /replace the lampshades. A/C worked, and was needed, as the room was a bit warm. TV worked, but only a few channels. We weren't there to watch TV, so didn't care. Coffee pot in the room w/ coffe & 2 breakfast bars daily. 2 chairs, small desk and 2 luggage stands, w/ small closet. It worked very well for us. Staff was fantastic. Plugged toilet call was responded to very quickly (5 min or less). Baggage holding room was locked and bags were tagged for us before departure. Doorman was always on duty. Conscierge helpful during day. Cute sitting room. Reasonable rates for computer in biz ctr, or bring your own and use free wireless. Elevators near our end were slow, but another set were faster and larger. Metro is RIGHT ACROSS the street (take #2 (express) to 96th, walk out at 94th SE exit). Deli's everywhere, and Duane Reed a few feet away. Definitely recommend for budget travellers who've travelled NYC before and realize most rooms are TINY, and EXPENSIVE. This was neither. We've never had a room this large in NYC, and never paid this little. Could be cleaner, but I wasn't afraid I would catch something. Area VERY safe, lots of food options, and metro close. This time we used public transit to/from LaGuardia -- and it was fine even w/ suitcases! Does take 1 full hour for bus ride tho, so if in a hurry, take a cab. Caught bus at 110th street.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach wake-up call...”
Reviews.Author: katonasgirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and did not have any problems...Wish I could say the same about this visit. The tv remote not working was the first problem and of course, according to the manager on duty there was no one available to fix or replace it.....ok ....let that go .....next morning....I got a wake up call....from a dirty disgusting cockroach crawling up my leg!!!! I immediately went to the front desk,,,squished bug in hand, wrapped in a tissue of course......all i was told was sorry there is nothing they can do for me....no refund..NOTHING.....because I had prepaid for the room !!! All the manager on duty gave me was a Days Hotel business card with "THE" manager's name on it and was told to call on Monday....I did.. it is now Wednesday I have left several messages and my phone number and still have not heard back from Nicole....... Oh, the hair dryer supplied by the hotel was broken too....and the elevators are nasty ...not just dirty but not safe ...lucky for me I was able to take the stairs.....I have a call into NYC Engineer's Department.....and I have filed accomplaint with the NYC Health Department....I don't know what happened since the last time I stayed here but it IS the last time! L.Rapp

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and nasty hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sandi106
Reviews.Content: Broken toilet, tv, electrical outlets. Filthy, moldy tub/shower. Dry-rotted drapes, terrible service. The "Promise" from Wyndham that they display in their rooms is a joke! Elevators were gross, even had a smashed banana in the door all day. Carpet stained all over, and the corners had a thick layer of dust built up in them. Understanding that renovation is costly, there is still no excuse for FILTH!!! I would not even recommend this place for my dogs. Don't waste your money. The only upside was the location & a wonderful cafe/bakery across the street - the Europan Café.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargin, great safe area”
Reviews.Author: mapleleaf17
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here in October 2008 for 5 nights. We found the hotel to be fine. Our room was fine, we had two double beds and the bathroom and room seemed clean. The only problem with our room was that our curtains did not seem to close but one clever friend would fasten them together with a hairpin every night before bed. I would recommend this to anyone trying to have a great visit to NYC and save some money. We only really would be at the hotel to sleep and it is so accessible to everything you will want to get to. It was also quiet. It is not a luxury hotel and it is not located in the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. It does have internet access for a fee off the main lobby. The main lobby is actually quite beautiful and fancy. The elevators are a little small but us three and our 2 pieces of luggage each were able to fit in with no problem. The hotel is steps away from a subway stop that gets you anywhere you need to go. We often would get back late at night and not worry about being three females walking alone by ourselves. A Duane Read drug store attached to the hotel (accessed by going outside the hotel) and plenty of other stores, restaurants and coffee shops are within a few minutes of the hotel. Central Park is also about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Our first night in NYC we walked uptown on Broadway about 5-10 minutes and decided to eat at Mama Mexica, at 2672 Broadway. This was one of our best meals in NYC. We had guacamole made at our table it was fantastic. They even had a mariachi band. This place also has a very romantic atomshpere. We also ate at the Key West Dinner just around the corner on Broadway also going uptown, great cheesecake.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: aurorapotter
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews a couple of days before arriving at the hotel and was extremely worried as my mum was used to above average hotels. I had NOTHING to be worried about. I had a great time staying at this hotel. Granted, the room was small but we spent only 6-8 hrs there max. a day for sleep and a shower. The toilets flushed, we had hot water, and an air conditioner for that one hot night. The staff was more then helpful (I approached them at check-in with a positive attitude and they were extremely friendly). There is a GREAT diner around the corner, the Key West Diner, and we had breakfast there every day with reasonable prices, and with customer service you can't beat. The subway is right across the street, and if you take the express, it's only 2 subway stops to 42nd street, and the journey is 10 minutes. Not too bad at a reasonably priced hotel in NYC. It is only a 15-20 minute walk to the Natural History Museum - and take that walk to visit the neighbourhood, and about the same amount of time - across Central Park - to the MET. The streets are quiet and safe at night. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeiseGal
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel at 9am on Tuesday morning and Reception tried to accommodate us immediately, despite check-in being 3pm. As they had no availability, they took our bags in to safe storage and couldn't have been more helpful.We stayed here for two nights midweek and had a lovely large room, two double beds and a nice clean bathroom. It was great value at a great location (literally around the corner from Line 1 subway) - I would highly recommend it if you're in NYC for a few days on a sightseeing / shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: EVNIJU
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant to stay after reading reviews, but found that the Days Hotel was perfect for us! We have previously stayed in Times Square and were now 50 blocks away, but the subway station was right across the street! The room was fine, it was clean, nothing fancy by any means, but we werent expecting that. The bellman was WONDERFUL, and gave us a ton of tips re:subway, taxi, and restaraunts. Very nice guy! Market was right across street so we could by soda or fruit, etc. Walking distance to Toms Diner (Seinfeld diner), and just 3 blocks from Central Park West. I will ABSOLUTELY stay here again,I wont even look around next time. This was way more relaxed and less "hurried" than Midtown/Times Square, and it was really easy to get there by subway. I liked NY the last time I was there, but now I LOVE NY and the Days Broadway was a big part of that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, for a New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dulljones
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews of Days Hotel we really expect find something between average and terrible. But our experience was really nice. Of course, you will find better hotels in other places for the same budget, but remember, this is Manhattan. The location is fantastic! Just a few steps from a subway station. Great neighborhood. Good restaurants nearby. And above all, three blocks from mid Central Park. If you want just a fine place to sleep after a long walk in New York this might be your hotel. The hotel staff is efficient and helpfull. Room and bathroom were clean and the beds are comfortable. If you forgive a noisy wooden floor (which the carpet hides), the freak elevators and you don´t book a hotel to watch tv, we strongly recommend it. P.s.: no bugs at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DukeB
Reviews.Content: I too was a bit concerned about staying here after reading some negative reviews. That said however, my experience was really very good. My overall impression was of a family type hotel in Europe. The hotel staff were friendly and answered my questions politely. They provided a guidebook with local subway maps. The lobby area was clean, cool, well appointed and there were free copies of the USA TODAY newspaper. My room was very clean and functional. No bugs. I really appreciated that the air conditioning was already on and cooling the room off when I arrived early in the evening. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised after all the house of horrors reviews”
Reviews.Author: chickracer
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was very worried. Let me tell you, it was for nothing! We were received by smiling, helpful staff (who were busy, but courteous) and yes, the rooms are not the ritz, but the beds were comfy and clean (I check EVERYTHING...a tad retentive), the bathroom was small, but clean. The toilet had flushing issues, but someone was up within 5 min of us calling (c'mon people, its a reaaallly old building). I found it to be a place I would stay again and recommend to friends as it was inexpensive, clean (and by clean I mean well cleaned by the staff. There are age issues with the building for sure, but that can't really be avoided. They ARE renovating), and very convenient (cab ride to times sq was around 7 bucks. you can walk, but make sure you have good, well broken-in shoes...) The subway is around the corner, and there are drugstores, shopping, and a really good diner (? city diner I think it was called...FABULOUS) p.s. the elevators are old and a little cranky, but we never had a problem. We felt safe, secure, and very well looked after at the days inn!

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand what everyone else has complained about”
Reviews.Author: 2UKBOYZ
Reviews.Content: We were most concerned reading previous experiences of this Hotel and did expect the worst! On arrival during the early evening, there were two staff on the Hotel desk, both very efficient, friendly, smiling, and very helpful indeed. Check-In was very efficient, and speedy. The main lobby area is dated, and drab, but notices posted did inform guests they apologised for the appearance, and that renovation was underway. We took one of the four lifts to the 4th floor (didn't notice they were slow), and once there the hallway was newly carpeted (no smelly carpets on this floor). Our room was large with two double beds, large screen multi channel TV, and coffee maker with complimentary coffee. Yes, the air conditioning unit was a touch noisy, and we were at the back of the hotel with no view, but we were there to sleep, not look out of the window! Both beds were very comfortable, with clean covers, and spotless crisp clean sheets, and pillowcases, and most important of all - no bed bugs at all!! The ensuite bathroom and WC was spotlessly clean, with plenty of clean soft white towels and complimentary toiletries. The local area the Hotel was in felt safe, and the diner round the block was excellent, and the subway just yards from the Hotel entrance. I felt the room price of around 200 USD a night was high, but I suppose average for New York. I rate this Hotel - Very Good to Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “No where near as bad as I expected”
Reviews.Author: brandonbearcub
Reviews.Content: OK. So I was panicking after I booked this hotel with a no cancellation policy and then I read the reviews. Well, some of the things were accurate, but most of the reviews were completely off. I was expecting the worst. Sure, we saw one bug..but big deal..it's a big city and even your own house has bugs from time to time. Yes the elevators were slow, but the building itself was fine. Great value in this hotel..super close to the subway and great diners right there. I'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: RachelBrasil
Reviews.Content: At first I was concern about the place since it had some really bad but some good reviews. I made my reservation thru a travel agency that booked on line for me. Since I wasn`t so sure about the hotel I made a call before to confirm my reservation and ask for a non-smoking room. The frond desk people were nice but the reservation sounded very angry and said to me to keep calling cause at that moment she couldn`t do anything about it (p.s. I was calling from Brasil). But well... I arrived at the place and what a surprise, it wasn`t bad at all! The people at the front desk were very nice and outgoing, I asked for a non-smoking room and they didn`t mind at all. Of course with this price you cannot expect much, but we got a really comfortable bed and clean private bathroom. Enough for our purpose, that was enjoy NY and not waste time in a hotel room. Nearby there is a great Greek restaurant, the one that has a pizzaria together! also it has a Subway, Donkin Donuds, a mini-market and a Delicatessen that we used to have breakfast there. The Subway station is only 2 stops to Times Square, center of downtown Manhattan. I was very well treated by everyone in front desk and some other people that stays in front of the hotel(I`m not sure if they were from security, or doorman, or maintenance... but they were really nice! P.S. The wi-fi internet is kind of slow, but even that, I guess, I was luck, cause I was able to connect most of the time that I needed to. P.S. When in the elevator press 1 for front desk and main door, cause if you press B you will be on the basement and it is very scare and messy there!

Reviews.Title: “Worn and dirty but functional”
Reviews.Author: Kheme
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Hotel in New York july of '07 for a week. The Hotel is very worn, and a bit dirty but the overall experience we had was fine enough. We had a room with a view over the backyard, not so very nice but hey....someone's gotta have it. Tiny room, and a carpet that smelled horribly but it was cleaned every day, the bed was made and we got clean towels every day. The aircondition made a terrible noice throughout the night, but we were so tired from the experience of the city so we fell asleep anyway. Bathroom was small and old but fine, and everything worked. Overall a nice stay for the price but I don't think I wanna stay here again. It was a bit TOO dirty for me...and the funky smell of the carpets everywhere was too much. Don't miss out on the nice diner round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel in New York, what more do you want”
Reviews.Author: jennyf76
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel and there was no one on reception. The security bloke called someone in the back room and a lady came out after a few minutes but did not seem at all bothered and not very friendly. Checked in ok and went upto room. There are 3 lifts (elevators !) but are very slow. Room was decent enough, double bed, fridge (which was a little noisy), ensuite, tv, desk, wardrobe with safe. Didn't hear much noise from the other people in the hotel. The location could not be better, a few shops (small supermarket and subway (sandwiches)) and the subway are just round the corner. Easily walk to Central Park from the hotel. On the last day we were able to leave our luggage in reception (locked up) and the porter who did this was friendly enough. Can recommend the city sightseeing tour bus (greyline).

Reviews.Title: “It's a funny thing!”
Reviews.Author: giatime1
Reviews.Content: it's a funny thing visiting NYC. There is an old Turkish saying "even with all your money, your still shamed" I think it suffered a little in the translation. Bottom line is this place is a dump. When I and my family visit NYC yearly every Christmas from California we usually stay 10-14 days. As you can imagine 10-14 days in NYC can be brutal on just the hotel expenses. So as such when the midtown hotel prices got to high for us we gave this filthy place a shot. 1 hour after check in we checked out. And to be honest with you were done with NYC until there is some kind of commitment on the part of the city to clean up their act. Bed bugs, roaches, filthy bedding, high prices? come on. The one thing you expect from a hotel is cleanliness, and when they are as filthy as this one you really have to ask yourself, what the hell am I doing here. A London Hotel is clean, a Los Angeles hotel is clean, a Sidney hotel is clean, A german hotel is clean, a Tokyo hotel is very clean, hell even an Istanbul hotel $240+ is clean. But the bottom line NYC inexpensive hotels are filthy places where customers can expect a staff that could care less about their expectations for a clean, safe hotel stay. forgive my rant, but the 11 days at the NY hilton without a prior reservation cost me $4135.00

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: luvtripsl
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an affordable place to stay in NY for a week over Christmas. The price was under $100 a night and we couldn't find anything comparable with a private bathroom so we booked it. I was nervous about staying here after the # of negative reviews but we decided to take our chances. The guys at the front desk were very friendly but we were not rude to them about any of our problems/questions. Ex. the pipes rattle at night, they explained that it's an old hotel and that's just how the pipes were built, but have plans to update these things. The carpets need to be replaced but I brought house shoes so it wasn't a problem. We thought this was a great location for never experiencing the subway before. Easily take the Red line down to Times Square and change over to any of the other lines to get anywhere. Easy & quick ride to Broadway shows & lots to do at all hours in Times Square. Would stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagellanMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I will never stay in this disgusting cesspool of a hotel ever again!!! I am no prima donna but have basic standards of what I expect from hotel acccomodation. Water is one of them. Awoke on second day of stay to find there was no water. Only discovered this after having used the toilet. Disgusting!! Went to front desk and complained. Front desk staff gave bad attitude and lied about not knowing the water was going off. It wasn't hard to catch them out as the three people behind the desk all gave different answers and contradicted each other. I asked to see manager and he only added to the lies as in he promised a refund for the nights accomodation due to no water....guess what...no refund to date. The hotel is very run down. At home we would say the furniture should be left out for "hard garbage". The lifts are extemely slow and old. As others have reported here, we also had to walk down the stairs after waiting 15 mins for an elevator. The hotel is a very long way from the action. The heater made loud noises all during the night and kept waking us up. Having just been to New York...do not stay this far uptown. Apart from the fact this hotel is disgusting, don't stay anywhere higher than 50th St.. There is a subway station not far from the hotel but it takes ages to get to where you want to be...you should aim to stay anywhere between 50th and 42nd St. I'll admit that I chose this hotel based on price. It's a fact of life though that you get what you pay for and unfortunately in New York you'll need to spend a bit extra to get something half decent in this city. This hotel ruined our trip to New York. On the upside though it forced us to get out and explore the city as we hated being in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but be aware”
Reviews.Author: Jormungand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of February, 2008. I was travelling as part of a school group. The first point I will make is that it is very common for school groups to stay here, and naturally good behaviour is not a guarantee - though I'd like to think my group was reasonably behaved! If this is likely to bother you, I strongly recommend looking for somewhere else to stay during your trip. We had a couple of issues with our room. Firstly, a pressure nozzle in the radiator would occasionally release, leaving steam hissing out for a time quite frequently. Colourfully described by my roommate as sounding like 'two mice having a fry-up', the noise was initially irritating but eventually became white noise. Secondly, the provided hair dryer broke after giving off a pitifully weak blast of lukewarm air. I could not, however, impugn upon the cleanliness of the room; unlike some other reviews posted here, every sheet was clean, as was the floor, bathroom, and the rest of the room. There were certainly no bedbugs. The decor of the hotel and rooms is rather dated, and although the lobby is made to look impressive it rather fails for a number of reasons. Firstly, there are books on tables that create a good look until you realise the books are glued together, which makes it look tacky rather than classy. The elevators broke down several times during our short time there: if you choose this hotel, work off the basis that you will need to haul your luggage up the stairs. The location is not in any way ideal, though the area is relatively safe. There are some good places to eat nearby, but a subway station on the same block as the hotel means that location becomes more or less a moot point unless you're looking for views. You won't get those here; our room had a nice view of the back alley behind the hotel. The Days Hotel Broadway is a reasonable choice provided you have a high tolerance limit and can put up with all the above. If you cannot, then I strongly advise giving the hotel a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Fine by me!”
Reviews.Author: wondermely
Reviews.Content: After reading so many bad reviews after I had booked the Days Hotel, I was scared of what we would encounter once we got there. Once there, it was FINE (especially for the price). We wanted to go to NYC for Valentine's Weekend and needed a cheap place to stay. Days Hotel delivered! The room was VERY clean (absolutely no cockroaches, bedbugs or any of that nonsense), the bathroom was immaculate and even had toiletries. Good closet space, TV, and there is a drug store right next door and a few really good places to eat. There is also a subway stop right outside the hotel. The staff even let us check in early. I really don't know why this hotel gets such a bad rap (must be prima donnas writing the reviews). The only suggestion for improvement would be the elevators, but if you need a clean, cheap place to stay (with your own bathroom) Days Hotel is it!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: britishkiwi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated and could do with modernising. The location is not too bad and it is very easy and safe to travel downtown at any time. There are many stores and retails outlets and other places to hang out in the area if you want to stay local. There is also a prity good cinema near 84th St. Central park is walking distance around the corner and is handy if you want to go for a walk. The hotel itself could do with a facelift and general cleanup. The staff are friendly and helpful, our room was cleaned to a good standard everyday without failure. I wanted another room because my room was close to the main road and was offered one almost straight away. The lifts are slow and i had to go down 6 floors by the stairwell a few times. The rooms are a good size and clean. The furniture needs to be updated as well as the decor. The only complaint i have is that my bed was very soft and awfull. I would stay here again if my budget was tight.

Reviews.Title: “Vastly improved”
Reviews.Author: Zadok99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Days Broadway previously and was compelled to write reviews describing an awful hotel. A client booked me into a New York hotel for 3 nights and I was horrified to discover they had chosen the Days Hotel Broadway. Anyway, circumstances conspired such that I could not change the reservation and I checked in with trepidation. I have to say the improvement is vast. The room was on the 14th floor and it was clean, the sheets were pristine, the bed was comfortable and the air conditioning/heating worked. My only problems were a lack of hot water and the truely awful elevators. It is hard to conceive how they can be so slow. I will have no hesitation about staying there in future.

Reviews.Title: “not the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vikingCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just spent 4 days there. We had booked without checking any rewievs prior to booking. We were concerned due to the mixed rewievs of this place, but decided to take a chance out of necessity. The hotel is old and has seen far better days. The hall ways are confusing, the stair wells and elevators can certainly do with renovations. Our room however was acceptable. It was large, the bath room was in excellent condition and the bed comfortable. We encountered none of the reported bug problems, and our room was cleaned to an acceptable standard. The furniture was old and could need replacing, and the television should certainly have been in better condition with regards to general state and the programmes it could receive. Unfortunately this hotel is in reality a youth hostel, as countless teenage school classes obstruted both the lobby and the elevators. The staff did not seem capable of imposing order on either kids or the teachers. With regards to transport 96th street station is right around the corner with easy acces to down town. The easiest and cheapest way to get around is to buy a 7 day metro card for us$ 28. A duane Read Pharmacy / drugstore on the corner can fill many of your needs and also has 1 hour photo service. If you do stay here we can highly recommend the Euorpan bakery & pizzaria on broadway. The have an outstanding selection of bread, cakes and fast food of superior quality.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with cockroaches or bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Stephaniieee24
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a travel company for our school trip to New York 7th Feb - 11th Feb. After reading the reviews on this site, i was very nervous to stay at this hotel. Me and my mates all had rooms on the 9th floor. Throughout our stay we had no problems with cockroaches and nobody had bed bug bites. The rooms got cleaned everyday, new bedding everyday too. The rooms did get quite warm so we had the a/c on most of the time. If your looking for a hotel just to sleep in, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is a youth hostel...................”
Reviews.Author: hotelguy123
Reviews.Content: Ditto the previous post.My wife and I hunted around to find a decent rate in Manhattan and this "looked" good...boy were we wrong. At check in,the front desk staff were rude and gave us a room.We went up to that floor and looked and all around and could not find the room,finally we opened the door to the stairs and lo and behold...the room was in the stairwell!! The inside was small and extremelly depressing and had a terrible smell. Also,the hotel was teeming with foreign students..it seems more like a youth hostel than a hotel. We complained and were given another room that looked halfway decent.we settled in were about to go to sleep.. and saw a big cockroach running across the bed! We were totally disgusted but too tired to leave. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel as Days Hotels usually are”
Reviews.Author: JohnJoeRambo
Reviews.Content: Just back from the hotel last week, wasnt actually staying at this hotel but moved after the one I was staying in had bed bugs which we seen when moving the pillows. This hotel but clean and average as expected..is every days hotel not more or less average but clean and comfortable. The room was small but was cleaned everyday. Seen no bed bugs/roaches! The hotel was getting mantainence work so wasnt exactly tidy but I wasnt in very much! not sure if I would stay again as I would rather put more money for an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES! Horrifying, Disgusting Experience! Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: checkmate85
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure I even know where to begin. I'll spare you the details of my truly horrifying experience. There is a disgusting stench of unidentifiable cooking food in the halls. There were HUGE bugs in the room, cockroaches in the lobby. The staff is ridiculously rude and unpleasant. This hotel is FILTHY. There were, what looked like fecal matter drips on my bathroom floor, the bed was broken on one side, underneath the bed was nasty, the heater stopped working on the room on the last day, the tub/shower was dirty. I have attached a photo of what my once white sock looked like after a few hours of walking around in my room. I think that should explain it all. Whatever you do, don't stay at this dump, you will really be sorry. Go around the corner to the Newton if you want the location (because it really is fabulous).

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs ! Be careful!”
Reviews.Author: traveler224422
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay just one night in the hotel, and got a cheap price, but it wasn't worth it. After just two hours in the bed, my husband had eight bed bug bites! The place was totally infested. It's gross. Be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Days Hotel 94th St.”
Reviews.Author: check-then-go
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful. Check-in efficient and at rate booked (through Priceline). Lobby charming. Room very clean, with appointments expected: TV, coffee maker with ample coffee, cream, sugar. Bathroom newly renovated, attractive. Best features: cleanliness, bathroom, free high speed wi-fi, proximity to subway station. Station for 1,2,3,9 (leading down Broadway and through center of West Side, Midtown, and Lower Manhattan, is less than 100 meters from front door. There are 2 entrances to subway: one on 96th street north of hotel, but the 96th St station also has one on 94th street just a "stone's throw" from the hotel entrance. Flying out from LaGuardia? On Saturday morning, cab arrived within 5 minutes of staff's call; we were at airport in 20 minutes. Local market offers all manner of toiletries and food. Restaurants abound. Breakfast at Cafe Con Leche nearby fills you up. Not so great: steam radiator heat must be turned down, down, down (on 4th floor). Elevator old and needed cleaning, but it worked flawlessly-just looked "dodgey." TV: channels offered little programing of interest. You'd think in NYC you'd get it all. For the price, I expected full cable television offerings. Manager could post more information about neighborhood services such as that oh-so-close-by subway entrance, buying a Metro Card, recommended places to eat. Price: ouch! High but it did compare to other places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: slugga13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel December 8th till the 12th. Convenient location for Subway and walking distance to Central Park. Convenience store on the corner was handy and Star Bucks, Subway in close proximity. Asked and paid for newly renovated room but was far from it. Room outdated and small. Not enough towels supplied for 3 people so had to ask which was supplied. Checkin /check out was done easy. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms lacked ventilation so in Summer would have to have aircon on to circulate room. Would be a problem if Aircon didn't work. Generally ok but nothing fantastic. I had hoped for more for my dollar but maybe that is just New York. Would stay hera again if nothing else available.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: xmastinnyc
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at this hotel for the busy Christmas season by calling the Days Inn 800 reservation number. Prior to arriving I called the actual hotel to confirm our reservation and was told that an error had been made. The person at the hotel informed me that the hotel did not allow the specified roll-away for our 10 year old son, and that the room did not allow for three people. I explained that when I made the reservation the person actually called the hotel to make sure a roll-away was available. The indifferent clerk said she didnt make the reservation and she didn't have any more rooms at our confirmed rate. We were offered a smoking room for $100 a night more. After several calls to the so-called Days Inn corporate customer service and several unreturned phone calls from the hotel's general manager. Days Inn refused to honor the rate that was provided on our confirmation. Fortunately we found a wonderful Comfort Inn in Queens. What is amazing is that the hotel had rooms available the weekend of our visit - which means management opted not honor our confirmation rate of $320/ night for an empty room! Not very bright.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as many say - check it out”
Reviews.Author: dutchbob
Reviews.Content: browsing 100s of hotels and still being able to book a room under 250 a night I saw this one. And let me tell you its not half as bad as stated here. If youre looking for a cheaper hotel in a good area consider it. Pros: both 123 and ACE subway lines are around the corner, deli and key west diner (try!), pharmacy/supermarket, starbucks etc too, spacious rooms for NY std (get a kingsize), opposite of central park, quiet and safe area, free wifi/coffee, clean room, nice view (no blind walls), nice and helpful doorman Cons: small corridors, small elevators (yes theyre slow), wifi is done by an outside company so if its down itll stay down for hrs (depending on a 2gig wifi get the sofitel, for mail its fine skype way too slow) Check out: deli at the corner, sushibar across the street good cheap and fresh delivery too, key west diner around the corner fast and good, pharmacy at the corner has a whole minimarket as well with fresh products. Yes wed go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as described in recent reviews”
Reviews.Author: IchChantal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel BEFORE I read the reviews on TripAdvisor. So after booking the pre-paid rate on their website I considered myself locked in the arrangement and was expecting the worse given the number of negative reviews about this hotel on TripAdvisor (especially just a week before I had booked!). Although I will probably book elsewhere next time, it would be because this hotel is uptown. The only two flaws I would comment on are the dirty carpet flooring and curtains in the room but EVERYTHING ELSE was acceptable. It was hugely surprising to find a coffee maker and hair dryer in the rooms and mini gym as well as Internet/Fax facilities around the back of the lobby. I had a 3-night stay at this place. Consider this hotel if: - you're on a tight budget - you want to be near the subway 1,2,3 trains (red line) (less than 1 minute from station) - you need an Upper West Side location, near Broadway I was staying in another Upper West Side 3* rated big-brand- name hotel before I changed to this hotel and really wouldn't rate them that far apart.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe everything you hear”
Reviews.Author: zeroinc
Reviews.Content: Believe you me, if you are to read the reviews of some of the people on here; you might not ever stay in a hotel in NYC or anywhere else for that matter. You have to remember that these people booked a room at a cheap price and are expecting the Palace Hotel. I was trying to stay in NYC for one night with my wife to see a comdian that we both liked alot. There were alot of hotels that would not book me because I was not staying for more than one night and it was "not acceptable for someone to occupy a room for one night that another person could occupy for up to three nights" (i.e we need the money) I went onto bookings.com and found the Days Inn on 94th street. It was one of the few hotels that would take us for only one night We arrived at the hotel at 11am and they told us that the room would not be ready until 3pm unless we wanted a smoking room. Sorry I dont sleep in ashtrays so I told her that we would wait for the room. We walked alllllllll around New York taking in the sites and it was great. We came back to the hotel at 3pm and they processed us and gave us room 515. We went to the elevator (which is a tiny little death trap) and got off on the fifth floor. The floor was VERY confusing as towards were to go. It reminded me of the Shining. We got in the door and entered the room. The room is very small. You have to remember the hotel was built in the 1920s. The bed was very comfortable. The closet was huge, but I thought it could use more hangers for people staying longer. The TV didn't get that many channels and every once in a while the sound would disappear and then come back. The heater made strange sounds, but it was nice and toasty in the room. The bathroom like most hotels is not made for tall people. I am about 6'3 and the shower didn't have that much room in it. Plus if you stepped out the wrong way, your foot would wind up in the toilet. Soap, shampoo, conditioner, towels, face clothes, and even a small tube of toothpaste were in the bathroom. The entire room was clean, included the towels and the linens. The staff needs to get a lesson on how to be a bit more personable, but that is the only thing I would change. The hotel is located on Broadway and you are close to alot of things. There is a drug store on the corner that is open 24 hours and if you want a decent dinner or an AWESOME breakfast, leave the hotel, take a left and head to the CITY DINER. Fantastic food and awesome prices.

Reviews.Title: “good surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ck_tsintao
Reviews.Content: this hotel has nothing exceptionnal but is a very good price vs. quality value. the room is clean, the sheets and towels are changed every day. the service is minimum but the people can help and answer your questions. i was afraid to have a bas experience by reading other reviews, but it was a good surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Don't look under the bed”
Reviews.Author: Not_The_Donald
Reviews.Content: We did and found discarded pamphlets, an empty shampoo bottle, and enough accumulated dust and dirt to convince us that the housekeeping staff hadn't been under there in a while. There was no deadbolt or other security lock on the room's entrance door, the toilet broke, the television was well worn and received only local and some basic cable channels (no ESPN, for example), the sink and shower both drained slowly, the front desk was curt, one thin towel each for the two of us, to hit just a few highlights. Maybe borderline acceptable for $75-100 in New York; for the $240 we paid, not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Very Misinformed”
Reviews.Author: 4starsandup
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to New York and we wanted to stay somewhere close to transit, and not too expensive. We just planned to sleep there. I will give it a plus for proximity to Subway, just steps away. That was the only good thing about it. First off, they provide discounted parking around the corner at a Hertz rent a car garage. This place does not have ample parking and attendant told me that they never have sufficient parking for the hotel. Ended up parking across the street $31/day. Room was very dingy. It smelled. Very cramped. Poor selection of TV channels. Couldn't watch Monday night football on TV, not available, in New York I might add. They advertise free internet, well I got on the second night for a brief time, or else couldn't get on. Elevators very small. The staff was not all that impressive. When I discussed the limit in parking, she said it wasn't her fault and she walked away. Not very cooperative. Would not return on next visit. Very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not high quality but good enough for the price!”
Reviews.Author: whitejewelrdh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights in November 2006. I had stayed here before and knew that for the price... it was clean enough, no bugs, and that it was affordable for NYC. Location was great, close to subway, close to Central Park!

Reviews.Title: “if you booked through pre-paid service, beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: beyondmoonlight
Reviews.Content: We used a housing booking service to book rooms at this hotel. So it is pre paid ahead of time. As my flight was landing late, I called the hotel to give them notification that it will be a very late check in. I believe the night receptionist gave the worst room the hotel have to me and to my colleague which are Room 401 and 402. There is the hotel sign outside the window but the rooms only have one layer of window blinds! So our rooms were lit up by the neon sign all night long. It was impossible to sleep! We requested to change room but the night reception would not do anything and tell us to wait until the morning when the Day shift manager comes in. I have to pay a $25 to upgrade my room to King size bed room which I did not hesitate as the double size bed room is really way to small for a couple to stay in for 5 days. So I strongly recemmend you insisting on NOT having the room on the fourth floor, especially 401 and 402! The rest is pretty decent with free wireless internet. The other negative thing is the carpet. It is pretty used and worn out. The hotel is located next to the metro station so it is very convenient to go around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent!”
Reviews.Author: KimV999
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia and of course you never know what to expect. We looked at some candid photos on this site and agreed they weren't too bad. When we arrived they were renovating the lobby so it looked a little messy, but check in was quick and easy. The room was located on the 11th floor and very spacious. The bathroom was clean and we got plenty of towels/soaps/toothpaste etc. The beds were perfect! The sheets were very very soft and pleasant. Everything about the room was good apart from the carpets, that seemed dusty and dirty. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel is old (someone told us it was pre-war and never renovated) - and so are the elevators, which were a bit of a pain, especially when you need to be on the 11th floor - and we were glad every time we got to our floor safely ;-) But all in all it's very good for a budget hotel, especially if you want to be in a quieter area with subway links going downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for the location but wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mommy1Indiana
Reviews.Content: We booked this reservation at the last minute, so I was pleased to be able to get the price at $150 per night on average (not including taxes and everything else they throw in). All the other hotels in New York City were way out of our price range. Funny how a Days Inn hotel anywhere else would be $50 a night! Our flight was delayed on Friday and we spent the night in the airport. I called Expedia and they called the hotel to see if they would refund the money for that night, and they would not - said it was their policy. So Expedia gave us a $100 voucher. The hotel is in a good location - next to subway and off Broadway and a few blocks from Central Park. It is old, wallpaper peeling, stained carpet, small room, but the bathroom was upgraded and it was quiet. The 'fitness center' they advertised was actually a small room with 3 pieces of equipment and one was broke! When we went to leave, we were told the night before that the cheapest way to get to LaGuardia was by taxi for $50. The next morning, somebody different told us it was by car service for $40. All in all, for the price we paid, if it was anywhere else, it would have been a lot nicer hotel room, but I guess we paid for the location!

Reviews.Title: “Surprizingly Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: rebeccasosa
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property, July 7-10, 2007. There were four of us in one room (husband, son 7, daughter-18 and myself). My husband was there for a convention and the kids and I tagged along for a vacation. We were a little skeptical with this property especially after all the negatives reviews it had received. But we had no choice as this was the hotel my husband’s employer booked. This stay was booked on hotels.com for $149 a night. But we were surprised at how decent the hotel was. CHECK-IN: Pretty simple, fast and easy. We arrived at 1:30pm and of course our room was not ready. The staff was polite and advised us to come back at 2:30pm. They recommended we leave our luggage (10 pieces) with the bellhop, David, while we went to get a quick bite. David took our entire luggage and secured it with a metal cord in the lobby area and our 2 laptops were safely secured in their office. We were a little hesitant, but we had no choice. We were really hungry since we left Miami at 7am! We came back an hour later and our room was ready. David delivered all of our belongings to our room and we tipped him for his hard work. ROOM: Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking 94th Street. The room was small but in NYC all the rooms are small. But were able to accommodate ourselves perfectly and the size of the room was never an issue. As a matter of fact, I did see a queen size room and that room was extremely small. So we were actually pretty lucky. The room was very nice, two queen beds with typical hotel (polyester) comforters and pillows, and pillow top mattresses. We all slept VERY well. I have to say that the best thing about this Days Inn (rm. 418) was the incredible bed. It was unbelievably soft. Not typical of this kind of hotel. The bathroom was in good shape, there were plenty of fluffy, white towels for all. Some no name brand toiletries were provided, as were a hairdryer and coffee maker. The bathroom was very clean. I loved the curved shower rod and it made me determined to include one in the upcoming renovation of my kids' bathroom. Elevator: We did not have a problem with the elevator, as had been reported by some. It was always right there when we wanted it. But the elevators were terribly small and very old. Area Restaurants: Tips for dinners: there various Italian Pizza Shops on every corner. As well as Japanese, Subway, McDonalds etc. There is a Sushi Place right across the street and they deliver. We order from them almost everyday we were there. Right on the corner of Broadway and 94th Street (as seen in pics) there is a 24hr Drug store called Duane Reade. We bought snacks and water from there to keep in or room. Oh one important note. They have an ATM inside that only charges $.99 fee for a transaction. Everywhere is $2.00 -$3.00 per transaction. Transportation: There are 3 Subway stations in a 2 block radius that can get you downtown. The station on 96th St will put you on the “ONE” train and that goes all the way to Canal St. (China Town shopping) and the World Trade Center area. They had a special for $10 you were able to ride 6 times. So 3 people could ride twice or 6 people could ride 6 times etc. Taxi fare into midtown (40th) was $13 and downtown (St. Marks & 14th ST) was $16-$17. The train is the way to go but it was hot but not too crowded. Overall: I did not encounter any bed bugs or roaches what so ever. No strange characters roaming the floors or the neighborhood. This is a great area. Central park is 2 blocks east the hotel. The staff was great. My worst complaint was the noise coming from our next door neighbors. They were out of the room very early (we like to sleep in) 7am sometimes and they would let the room door slam continuously! Very annoying. But we dealt with it. After all we were in the “CITY THAT NEVER SLEEPS!” We enjoyed our stay. Have fun in NYC -- always a great family destination.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somehere else.”
Reviews.Author: dabrothman
Reviews.Content: Visited NY for my aunts 90th B-day. They live walking distance from the hotel. This and the bed were the only positives. We had two rooms. The first room was in the stairwell. IF YOU MUST STAY HERE, DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 409! The room was small, the wallpaper was torn and there was a hole in the wall. The room was very small and dirty. We were able to move to a "renovated" room the second night which was much larger. This room had an armoir that was already warped and broken, There was a hole in the carpet and the bathmat looked like it was cut out by a 2 year old. The sink had two "cold" knobs. The doors look and feel like they are only somewhat secure even when locked. There was an old musty smell throughout the "hotel" and it looked like any rif raff off the street stopped in the lobby to hang out. The hallway was narrow and the room numbers were all over the place. Elevators barely held 4 people and were dirty. No restaurant but plenty in the area. People who work there are clueless and are not into customer relations. Stay at the Newton around the corner or better yet, dig into your wallet and stay at a big box hotel and take a cab to the area.

Reviews.Title: “it's okay but don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: 57Anthony
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to NY, staying in this Days Hotel at Broadway/west 94th street. The staff was unpolite (except for the concierge, great guy!!). I booked a room for my son and me, booked for double beds but got a room with one bed double sized. So as soon as I noticed this I phoned the reception and told them that a mistake happened, as I made a pre-paid reservation for a room with two beds. We're sorry this is what you can get, was the reply. And they added: we consider a reservation as a request. Excuse me??!! A pre-paid reservation for a room with two beds, considered as a request? After I got a bit upset and spoke to three (!) people at the phone, while still in the wrong room, they decided to give me a room with two beds. I think my determined attitude made them decide to give me another room. What if you're not so determined as a guest? The room was shabby, the bathroom dirty (and stayed dirty). Beds were clean and allright. The carpet smelled a bit. The fan/airco made a lot of noise. Okay, I used the hotel and room to sleep. And the beds were okay. So what else did I need? Maybe a staff that acted a bit more polite?! The location of the hotel is fine, near a subway station and in a fine quiet area. Conclusion: it's minimal, okay for the night but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs-- Beware!”
Reviews.Author: JBRZ
Reviews.Content: Be warned, we stayed for three days and came home covered in bites. Disgusting! Our doctor said "bed bugs".

Reviews.Title: “The Quality hotel :) Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: gerzee16
Reviews.Content: OK firstly, I gotta say for the price we received we weren't expecting a whole lot. And I gotta say the place delivered :) We got a far better hotel right on Time Square for a lot less than this place. I'll take you through it as we experienced it. As we checked in, the lobby looked presentable and there were a load of "please forgive our appearance the hotel is being refurbished". The staff were polite and seemed nice. It kinda suited us as we were tired and just wanted to drop our bags. One of the lads hopped on the lift and it nearly jammed when he stepped in. When the door opened on our floor the halls stank... that was before we even walked into our rooms. Now the rooms, they were a decent enough size but they looked like they hadn't been cleaned since the place was built. The toilet didn't flush and we had to jimmy it up just to make it work. The shower was blocked and the water flooded whenever someone took one. the inside of the cabinets had "hotel from hell 2005" written by previous occupants... so u could tell the cleaning was right up to scratch. It sounds like I am being a tad negative here, so I'll jump to put some positive. We did have a real fun experience as we left to go out. The lift jammed between floors and we got to see New york's finest called in (while the hotel owner told them the occupants of the stuck lift were "not distressed"). Was even cool getting a few snapshots of the fire engine as it rescued the people stuck in the lift :). All in all the place stank, the TV only worked if you wanted to listen to the radio... Then we had a lovely surprise the next morning when we awoke with bites of some kind all over our backs from whatever infested the beds. But again... the staff were friendly :) Stay in this place if u don't mind risking getting the plague or getting mugged. The cheery message in your room "please ensure all doors are deadbolted" said it all. I can't say it enough to ring around as this place is miles off then beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: karababe
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from new york and was very impressed by this hotel, we could not fault anything. We had everything we needed in the room, plus very clean bathroom and beds. The staff were also very helpful and made it a very pleasant stay for us. All in all we rated this hotel as excellent and would definitly stay there for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Small, old but good”
Reviews.Author: JJNorth
Reviews.Content: At first my sister and I were a little nervous because we didn't know what to expect. But after arriving we found that the lobby is beautiful, the staff is really friendly and helpful. The rooms are small and old but clean. The location was great. We walked to as much as we could, and the subway is right out the front door. Lots of nice shops and great restaurants in the area. Very Safe. Very Friendly. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, but spend the extra $50 for some place better”
Reviews.Author: Il_Toast
Reviews.Content: The Days Hotel Broadway is an acceptable, no-frills, place with a great location across the street from Symphony Space. I had no problems with my room, which was shabby but clean with a comfortable bed (but no alarm clock). The problems were with service. My business schedule while in New York required me to be out quite late into the evening, so I had hoped to sleep late in the mornings. Despite the "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door, I heard the housekeeping staff shouting to each other across the floor around 9am each morning. This was not simple work conversation, but out-and-out shouting. The elevator situation is dire. There seem to be four elevators, although I cannot be sure how many work. They are incredibly slow and very small (two or three people with luggage would be the maximum load). One morning opted for the stairs; the windows in the stairwell had been left open, and pouring rain was covering the stairs with water. Needless to say, I fell down the first flight of stairs I encountered. I decided that the 10-minute wait for the elevator was a a small price to pay to avoid the possible injury those stairs could cause. If you're looking for a decent place and have no problem dealing with unfriendly, vaguely incompetent people, the Days Hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Feared the worst.....?”
Reviews.Author: boadle
Reviews.Content: After booking our stay at Days via the net. I decided to read up on some reviews (I KNOW! should have checked it out first!!) Upon reading the entries about cockroaches and poor service I was put into a state of panic! The reality I'm happy to say turned out to be completely different! I have certainly stayed in plusher venues than Days. However, we were more than happy with the service provided by Pavel and the desk staff. The room was cleaned and bedding and towels changed daily. We were looking for somewhere to sleep while we spent the rest of our time on vacation! Lets face it NO hotel is ever as good as home.. and we did not expect it to be! This hotel has had a bum rap from some of the reviewers and I would simply say. This is a nice friendly hotel, NOT the ritz, but perfect for those on a budget who are more concerned with NEW YORK than the hotel they're staying in! We liked it! simple as that!

Reviews.Title: “friendly; simple; ageing”
Reviews.Author: cmonkeydog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in Aug 2005 (Katrina weekend, actually!). The friendly front desk upgraded us to a one-bedroom suite when we mentioned it was our anniversary. Parking is around the corner in a public lot and costs typical NYC rates. Our room was showing its age, and the A/C unit in the window dripped all night so we constantly thought it was raining. The room was clean but rather old. We had a pleasant stay and got a great bargain, but I wouldn't rave about the place. And more recent reviews sound like it's gone downhill...

Reviews.Title: “Once again - you pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: DarrenBailes
Reviews.Content: My second trip to NYC, and knew what to expect for the price that we paid. The room was a good size, with a very nice bathroom and we had a cracking view looking down onto times square. We had a roll away bed in the room and still had loads of space there, and it was exceptionally clean. I went with two friends in one room and we all thought we had an excellent deal for what we paid. Location was once again excellent and had no problems with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing....”
Reviews.Author: noggin45
Reviews.Content: before coming to this hotel we read many reviews and was expecting the worst... when we got there we were shown to our rooms and to our surprise they was not atall bad. Our bedroom is the double room shown in the pictures. it is very spacious, In this room there were no cockroaches or any bug of any sort, However there were stains on the bed sheets but this was one thing we had to overlook. The television worked and was to a good standard. One major issue was whenever we went to open the door or touch anything we were bound to get an electric shock. The bedroom was very hot and the windows were taped up but this wasnt too bad as when we were there it snowed.

Reviews.Title: “You Pay for what You Get!”
Reviews.Author: skibunnie630
Reviews.Content: I read some really horrible reviews about this hotel prior to my trip, but I chose to brave the negative comments and stay there anyway. I knew going into it that I wasn't staying at the Sheraton or Omni, so my expectations were not very high. The hotel is under renovations at present so things look really shabby. I have to admit the elevators terrified me, but I got through it ok. The room was actually decent and comfortable. The lobby and corridors were nothing to look at, but once we got to our room we were ok. I work in the hotel industry and am very critical of pretty much everything, but I lower my standards when I choose to stay at a cheaper place. The sheets were clean, and so was the bathroom, the carpet needed replaced, but still wasn't completely horrible, and the beds were actually comfortable. My biggest complaint about the room were the filthy blinds. They were in desperate need of a cleaning. If you are on a budget and just need a place to sleep then this hotel is just fine. The staff is courteous and the rooms are decent. You don't have to worry about all the noise and lights from Midtown, and there is a subway stop right across the street which is extremely convenient. If you do decide to stay here keep in mind that you pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Belfast23
Reviews.Content: It's not very often I agree with all the bad reviews there are for hotels, but this place lives up to them all. The hall ways are falling apart, the staff are EXTREMELY rude, and the room was in the worst condition I've ever seen. I've travelled most of the world backpacking, stayed in some low budget hostels and hotels but they have always given me a bed worth sleeping in, but not this hotel. The bed dipped in the middle and the bed clothes were torn. I can honestly say I was disgusted, never again!

Reviews.Title: “Management are crooks”
Reviews.Author: MichaelTantini
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with a free night from the Cendant best rate program. Upon check-in, they wanted to charge us for the night. We stated that is was a free night and nothing had to be paid. After discussing with the Days Inn Central Reservation agents, they agreed that we don't need to pay for the night. In the evening, when we came back from a sightseeing tour we found our room's door to be locked. We went to the reception and had to discuss the matter again. Next day, I had to leave early and my wife did the check-out on her own. Three guys of the staff and one women stayed around here, shouted at her and had her to pay for the night! I would call it sexual harassement. Why could not one single receptionist discuss the matter with her alone? And why did they want to charge her despite it was a free night? She signed the credit card slip and of course, our CC card company denied the payment to the Days Inn Broadway. We were basically happy with the hotel and expescially with the great location but the management and staff suck!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't expect the Ritz, but we didn't bargain on it being the Pits!!!!”
Reviews.Author: friends101
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn is the proud owner of the biggest dump in New York!! i can only reiterate the previous writer's comments and add that we also experienced cockroaches in our room, the most unbelievably discusting stench on floor 2 that was so bad that you had to hold your hand over your nose whilst running from the (dangerous) lift to the room, electric shocks everytime we went to open a door, table lamp litterally snapped in half with exposed wires, hairs in the bath, shower not working, etc etc. I could go on and on. a final word of warning - if you arrange your transport back to the airport through the hotel, prepare to be ripped off. We were given a price to include toll and asked to leave a $10 deposit to be knocked off the fare, only the driver claimed not to know anything about the deposit and demanded full fare + toll + tip!!!!!!!!! If for some insane reason you do still go th this Hotel then I can recommend 'Key West Diner' for breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blackrod
Reviews.Content: We actually checked this website before booking this hotel but I can only assume the reasonable reports at the time were written by people on another planet. The place was filthy. There is building work going on (which we weren't told about) which just added to the mess. Our room was small and in dire need of decorating just like the rest of the hotel! The staff were helpful and friendly but that was the ONLY plus point. Avoid this hotel at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: sammy22
Reviews.Content: Dear Reader, This hotel was the dumps. When my family of 4 turned the street corner towards the hotel, we immediately knew that we were in a nasty part of town. After all we had been through (a delayed flight, rain, and a late shuttle bus) all we wanted was a nice hotel room. When we stepped inside the hotel it looked charming enough, and the staff was kind. After checking in we walked to the elevator and what we witnessed was shocking, dirty air vents, peeling tile, peeling wallpaper, dust & debris everywhere. While stepping out of the elevator we encountered a nasty, dirty, dusty, and just plain unclean lobby. It looked as if a tornado of renovation (that had been there for 20 decades) went through it. Opening the door to our hotel room was like opening the gates to another portal called: Dumpoland! It was repulsive.. the carpet was worn and dirty, the wallpaper was stuck to the wall with thumbtacks, the hot water didn't work (in fact the bathroom was horrendous.. with dirt,grime,and dust in every crease and crack), I do not want to go on, but so long as I am preventing another living and breathing human being from checking into that hotel. The window view was of a beautifully built brick wall. The sheets were dirty and greasy, and my Mother did not get a wink of sleep that night. It was her dream to go to New York and see the Macy's Thanksgiving day parade, she was almost in tears that night and the next morning, she could not bear to see her family stay in that filthy hotel. The next morning my brother and I were woken up very early by my Mom and Dad, we changed and called a cab. We stayed at that hotel for only 4 1/2 hours (if you still aren't convinced it was that bad), we found a Holiday Inn for a much cheaper price. The Holiday Inn was nicer than any ounce of that hotel. It was clean and close to the parade route, it was more than we ever could have asked for. My Mother's dream came true that day, just not the first night. So please don't stay in that hotel for all our sakes.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: wr6281
Reviews.Content: Between the cockroaches and the disgusting smell coming from the shower curtain, the ultra dirty carpet and long hairs I found all over the comforter I thought I was on some hidden camera joke - This place is the worst I have ever stayed in 25 years of business travel. The elevators were so dirty you wouldn't want to lean on the walls. The only good thing was the people, they were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: Life_Plein_Air
Reviews.Content: Really terrible. I realize NYC is expense, but you can surely do better.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear”
Reviews.Author: kittenpuss
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York, and my daughter and I were very excited. The travel agent booked this hotel for us, but after reading the previous reviews I was a bit hesitant about staying here, but thought hey it can't be too bad. Well, it was! Without a doubt it was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was old, dark and dingy, we had a lovely view of the alley. The bathroom old and gross. The hallway carpet was covered in bits of plaster, looked like it had been there a while. So much for housekeeping. If they can't keep a hallway clean then what does it say about the room cleaning standards. Actually we never felt 'clean' during our 4 day stay. The sheets were also old and thin. Apparently, they have been renovating for years. Didn't look like they achieved much. Oh, also when we used the toilet it blocked up. I asked the fellow who fixed it (with a large plunger !)if this happened frequently and he grunted 'yes'. The front desk staff were not rude but totally indifferent. Staying here totally ruined our New York stay, we couldn't wait to leave. Do yourself a favour, do not stay here, there must be much nicer hotels around for the same price. Also, it is too far away from everything. it cost a fortune in cab fares. We will never stay in another Days Hotel chain again.

Reviews.Title: “My experience at Days Hotel Broadway”
Reviews.Author: ncuuop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days in Sept of 2006 and the stay was "ok" but I guess "good" for the price. We paid close to 300 per night. Plus the hotel is located 3 - 4 subway stops from Times Square. The staff was nice, the rooms were as clean as they could be. The hotel is old and dingy but if you have a full schedule it probably would not matter. I would not stay at the hotel again because there were some nicer hotels that averaged about 300 per night. So the extra 19 or so dollars would have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good job there's so much to see in New York!”
Reviews.Author: Dr3w
Reviews.Content: Being so excited about arriving in New York (three hours late, but we caught the Manhatten skyline all lit up, so not so bad) so we weren't wholly bothered about our hotel. That was until we used the bathroom - it was FILTHY. The hot tap was hanging off and the plug was obviously having issues staying in the hole. The room itself wasn't too bad, the bed was comfortable, and we were towards the back, so noise was at a minimum. We didn't have much of a view though, but that was mainly to do with the thick greasy film of dirt on the window. It was lovely and warm though as the hot water pipe ran down the wall next to the bed - not a great thing to use if you are unsteady in the morning as it was boiling hot. Overall the location is great if you don't wan to stay in the middle of the city. There is a subway station on the corner, a great diner for breakfast and you have the prestige of saying that you stayed 'on Broadway' . The hotel is just a bit tired

Reviews.Title: “One Star at Most”
Reviews.Author: prodigyqb
Reviews.Content: I paid $179 for one night for a two double bed room on the 11th floor. I wasn't expecting anything special, and i got what I expected. The hotel is just old and run down, plain and simple. The elevators can fit 3 people very tightly with one small carry-on style bag each. The elevator felt like it was going to break, and the door hardly shut. We got to the room and the carpet was very old and stained; to the point where you really didn't wanna take off your shoes. The beds were okay. They were clean. There was an old air conditioner hanging out the window. The air conditioner made a horrible noise throughout the night and never got cold. The seal around the window consisted of duct tape. I must say the bathroom looked decent, with marble countertop and a nice sink. The tub on the otherhand was kind of dingy and the water would not go down. By the time it was my turn to shower, I was standing in water halfway up my shins. I brought my laptop because they said they had free wireless. It didnt work, big suprise. The front desk person had no clue how to fix it either. I had to park on the street and there was a $35 one night fee to use a parking garage. I did not see any cockroaches as other people stated. The place served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location!”
Reviews.Author: Rissa0401
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my boyfriend and family. There were 5 of us and I had requsted a cot for the 2 double bed room. I had called the hotel 2 days before our trip to confirm and there were some issues (i.e. there are limited large rooms that will fit a cot.) After speaking with the manager a few times, he ensured me that I will not have a problem. Arriving at the hotel, we were there really early, they allowed us free storage of our bags. Lobby had an old charm to it. Parking was 1 block away but it was close and was about $22 USD which is reasonable. Upon check in, front desk told me that the room was prepared and that a cot should be in the room. The room was large even included "kitchenette area". The cot wasnt there as of yet, but was brought in within 30 minutes. For five ppl, we were able to move around fine. The bathroom was small but reasonable since it is an old hotel. The location was good since we have to nyc many times using the subway was convieneint for us. The area was great...lively...with a variety of food to choose from. The price is a great value and will be staying there again for my august visit.

Reviews.Title: “OK, OK, so it isn't the Waldof Astoria....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My little brother and I stayed at the Days Hotel Broadway In NYC for one week from July 1-9 2006. We stayed on the second floor and I have to say it wasnt the nicest floor. The elevator missed our floor the second day we were there and we noticed the floor above it were much cleaner and more well maintained. The room was not the best but hey.....we weren't there to be in the hotel room anyway and yes....it smelled a little and yes....but i did not see one insect and our room was cleaned, I should be us to the ghetto being from East Los Angeles..... beds were made and everything was left extra clean and tidy by the time we got back from running around trying to get laid, checking out the NYC sights and the NYC girls. The locations was great. the 1, 2, and 3 subway station is literally across the street and there is a great pizza place called Famiglia's on 96 th St. like two blocks up. When you get on and off the subway it says 96th St but if you walk to the far end of the corridor you end up on 94th and Broadway. the check in was great, the service was great. that's all i really cared for. they even gave us an extra pilow and an iron, no questions asked. bed was comfy. had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has major cleanliness issues. The location is good, close to transportation and restaurants, but bring your drain cleaner and some insect spray. There are cigarette butts in the hallway (even though it's no smoking) the bathtub doesn't drain, and yes, insect and signs of rodents in the rooms. Both window shades were broken, and the elevator didn't work. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: recran
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Location is fine - super close to red lines and several places to eat. We saw rooms on floors 8-10 (several family members staying in different rooms) and all were fine. Didn't see any curling carpet others complained of. Clean bathroom, clean sheets, etc. Halls are narrow and warm since AC is from window units in each room. No big - we weren't there to hang out in the halls. Key West was not that good - I'd recommend only for snacks and drinks, not for an actual meal. Whatever you do, don't ask the hotel to call a cab for you. They call a car service that charges more than double what the city taxis charge. We were appalled. And don't make any long distance phone calls - $22/minute. Knowing all this, I'd stay there again if I couldn't find somewhere else nicer for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Amazing Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the quality inn broadway (changed names since to the days inn) for 5 nights in December. I would rate the hotel 10 out of 10! The hotel was amazing, the staff where super friendly and helpfull, you would think it was more of a 3* than a 2* to be honest. It had its own little gym and everything, the subway is just around the corner and there is a mcdonalds and dunkin doughnuts just around the corner over the road. There is also an amazing little jazz bar just a 5 minute walk away. It was spotlessly clean, we ended up with 2 double beds in the room which was handy we ended up using it for all our souverners! Id defo recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to new york, its a nice little hotel. Take care and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A good value & quiet budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jo2477
Reviews.Content: We were also a bit hesitant about staying here having read the earlier reviews! However we found that the room, although basic, was kept clean throughout our stay, & the hotel was in a quiet, leafy residential area with some fantastic restaurants and diners nearby.
