It was a welcome break from the hustle, heat and noise of uptown New York, and we had no concerns about safety returning on the subway for the 10-minute journey late at night (which was a pleasant surprise). In summary, a good budget choice which was perfect for a 5 night break and the money we saved from staying downtown allowed to us to experience more whilst we were away. DO GO TO THE KEY WEST DINER - turn right out of hotel and right again onto Broadway - fantastic menu, good value and open 6am-midnight daily - always packed with locals which is the best recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “shabby but cosy”
Reviews.Author: ScissorsAndPens
Reviews.Content: I thought the Days Inn Hotel would be perfect for me and it was. Great location, easy to get there from the subway at 94th St. The staff was lovely, the room was comfy. It's shabby, needs paint & refurbishing but I was cosy and comfortable. Travelling alone as a woman I am picky about safety & this hotel was very secure. No frills but I loved it & would definitely return. You won't be sorry if you choose this hotel expecting no frills but a safe & clean place to stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to treat customers with seriousness”
Reviews.Author: Fossie54
Reviews.Content: Disappointed. Arrived to be told that what we booked we could not have. No twin beds available despite being told there would be. Double would have to do. Told they would come back in two days to advise. They didnt bother. Windows need a good clean, but generally clean. Shower curtain stank terribly due to poor ventilation. Rest was average.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: mclee_ny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while apartment hunting on the Upper West Side, and had no problems whatsoever. It had pretty much what we wanted and expected in a hotel. The room was large enough for two people not to feel too cramped, there's free (but slow) wireless, they were happy to receive a fax for us, check-in and check-out were fast, bathrooms and linens were clean and everyone was professional. On the 11th floor where we were, street noise was minimal. The location is fantastic, just a few steps to a subway stop, and you can easily walk to lots of tasty restaurants and cafes in a variety of price ranges. Of course, you're not paying a super-high price, so you should have some realistic expectations. There was some grunginess where the carpet was coming off the floor in the corners, but nothing that bothered us (we just plopped our suitcase on top of it). Some of the elevators are admittedly a bit sketchy, but nothing really scary, just old and slow (if it really bothers you, there are newer and older elevators, and you can always choose the nicer ones). So all told, don't be scared off by this hotel! If you're looking for a place to drop your bags and get a good nights sleep in a great location without paying too much, this fits the bill, no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Days Hotel Broadway”
Reviews.Author: l8ura
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was really worried about going to the Days Hotel Broadway when I read the reviews on this site, however I was plesantly surprised upon arrival. When we checked in the hotel staff were all really friendly, they even upgraded us free of charge, to a king size bed. The room was a good size, it looked as though it had just been refurbished, as the carpets looked new. The place was spotless and there was not one nasty creepy crawly in site. Our room looked right on to Broadway, which was good, as I liked to look out the window alot. For the money that we paid for this holiday, we were absolutely delighted with it. We used the subways alot, & there is a subway station just across the road, I would recommend that you purchase an all day hopper pass for just $7.00 per day, these are excellent value for money, and the number 1 train takes you from the top to the bottom of the island so you don't need to get of and transfer. The hotel is quite far up, but we liked to walk up through Central Park then cut across, you will lose so much weight by the end of this holiday with all the walking. A taxi to Times Square cost about $10.00, not bad. I can't forget please check out Keywest resturant, the food is fantastic!!! I really, really enjoyed this holiday, we saved so much money by booking the Days Hotel Broadway, and we were not disappointed, we had a fantastic time and so will you, we had room 429. Please don't be put of by other peoples reviews because I was really worried, but in the end we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the single traveler...”
Reviews.Author: SixAlpha
Reviews.Content: While traveling alone on a budget for a quick weekend trip to NYC, this hotel did the trick. The place has definitely seen its better years; during my stay the hotel was being renovated so the rooms were hit or miss. The first room I was offered was dark and musty, in a back corner of the hotel with a window that looked into a dark alley. The staff was very helpful when I turned down that room, and were able to give me a recently renovated room that overlooked Broadway. They also honored my request for a late check-out. The room was small but quiet and everything worked. You can't beat the location - lots of shops around, close to Central Park, and just a couple blocks from the subway and the bus to LaGuardia Airport. While I wouldn't take my family here, if traveling alone, especially if I could get a good price, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, just dont expect too much and its fair”
Reviews.Author: Lawsash
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on 9-12 March and stayed on the 10th floor. Room itself had seen better days and we could pick holes in it ie there was damp on the inside of the windows, noisy air conditioning, broken bath tap (still worked though!) etc but as a whole it was fine. The room was clean on arrival and regularly cleaned every day. The bed had crisp clean sheets and was very comfortable. Some of the hotel staff were indifferent, others were very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel was a little away from most tourist attractions but at the price we paid I think it was only to be expected. The hotel is located just by an underground station so a short trip and you can be in the heart of the city in no time. However noise from traffic can be a problem if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap hotel, what you pay is what you get”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a year 12 school trip and when we arrived at the hotel it took up to 2 hours for us all to be assigned rooms, although we were "lucky" in that we got a room straight away, only to walk into it and smell the strongest, most stale cigarette smell despite it supposedly being a non-smoking room. Fortunately after complaining the staff were very polite and helpful and did in fact move us to another room although much better we found the lamp, hairdryer and toilet didn't work properly (the toilets actually became blocked in several people's rooms including ours.) All in all I would say that for what you pay and the location the hotel isn't bad but I certainly wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okish in certia rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was ok if you wanted just a place to sleep at night which is what you want in new york but dats about all it offered. my college went there last year and in one room their was cockroachs, in another everything had static on it, another the tv was broken, another the toliet didnt flush....

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: RogersTravels
Reviews.Content: Having seen some other reviews (some from when it was a Quality hotel), I was somewhat apprehensive about visiting this hotel, but as it was part of a package had no choice. In reality the hotel was much better than I expected and had no serious faults. I was in a twin room, with two single beds (about 3/4 of a European double) and a large TV. Window was small and looked into a dark 'lighting' well - so no view. The room had been refurbished recently and was well lit with a single ceiling light and central bedside lamp. Bathroom had a bath with shower over. Shower was hit and miss in temprature and flow, depending on the water consumption in the building, so probably best to not shower when everyone else is! Bed linen was changed every day, but the second day had some marks on from storage or transport. There is no bar or restaurant, but the area has plenty of diners and restaurants with the ones we tried all being excellent. The nearest diner is just around the corner on Broadway (out of the hotel, turn right onto Broadway, and a few meters along). I would use this hotel again as it was satisfactory as a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, Moldy and the Place Not to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother, aunt and I stayed in room 704 of this hotel this past weekend. The roon we were given was completely unacceptable. The room was hot, although it was only in the 20's and 30's at night, even though we ran the air conditioner all night. There was an abundance of mold growing on the ceiling in the bathroom. The carpeting by the window of the room was wet, frayed, dirty - gross. We complained about the room but were told that another was not available. The next afternoon, after a failed attempt to clean the mold, we were given another room that was better, but still not what I would consider adequate. I would definitely not stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. I probably would not stay at any Days Inn anywhere because of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very suprised when i actually arrived at the hotel as i had read bad reviews on the accomodation. My experience wasnt bad at all........the hotel was everything i expect it to be........good value for money.......great location...friendly staff......good facilities.......and the hotel room was fine........no problem at all.........i dont know what people are fussing about.........i had a great time and would consider staying at this hotel on my next arrival to New York........

Reviews.Title: “don,t stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinsreview
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family and wish i had never booked to stay there it is the only hotel you wipe your feet on the way out!!!! it is basically filthy terrible staff only spoke english when money was involved, the heating was wrong the bed was filthty the bathroom you had to see it to belive it the sprinkler system was jammed with paper, i could go on and on, but my travel agent refunded all of my money on return to the uk as the hotel would not answer their requests, my advice DO NOT WASTE YOU MONEY OR STAY IN NEW YORK HERE GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!ITS APAULING!!! I know they have changed the name of this dump but do not even go there take my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we thought!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Jan and on arrival we were allocated a room (on the 9th floor) that was in a very poor condition, with obvious signs of wear and tear and with a terrible shower that would not work properly- temperature of the water could not be controlled and we struggled to turn the thing on and off. However upon request to reception they changed our room without question to one on the fifth floor and we were plesantly surprized! The room was clean and had obviously been updated. The bathroom facilities were modern, all worked really well (including the shower and hair-dryer) and the room was clean with adequate heating. Overall a budget hotel, in a great location- very near the subway, with a McDonalds close by and a 24 hour pharmacy on the corner. Great-considering the very little time you will spend in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were very apprehensive about staying at the Days Inn after reading the reviews on this website so we prepared for the worst. Upon arriving the reception staff to our surprise were not rude at all and in fact were very helpful. We were apparently given a refurbished room ( I hate to think what it looked like prior to refurbishment) which was better than expected. We did have an alarm clock and the sheets were clean but we were a bit unsure about the top blankets. The bath was ok but could have been cleaner and the floor definately looked like it could have done with a clean. One word of advice is not to take your best white towel as once it has been taken by the cleaners along with all the other towels, you will not be able to get it back. Also be careful with the lady selling trips etc in the lobby as you will probably find a lot cheaper elsewhere. We had a fantastic time in New York and did not spend much time in the room anyway apart from sleeping and showering so all in all we had a good deal. I am looking forward to going back soon but not too sure if I will stay at the Days Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful week in New York having booked five rooms for 13 female family members ranging in ages from 23-70. Initially some of the ladies were allocated rooms on the eight floor and they were in much need of decoration however the rooms were clean, bedding actually looked new with a plentyful supply of towels etc in the bathroom, alarm clock, coffee maker etc. However, on enquiring at the reception desk about refurbished rooms we were moved to the fourth floor it would appear these rooms have been refurbished and were in a better state of decoration. We had no problems with the lifts, and we found the staff to be friendly and helpful when asked questions. If your only interested in a clean bed and bathroom and not bothered about hotel facilities then this hotel is fine for a few days especially when you are out from morning till night which you will be in New York there is just so much to see and do. There are a number of shops, chemist, supermarket, trinket shops etc all within walking distance. We took taxi's to times square, Macys etc daily at a cost of around $10 per trip plus tip and had no problems - do wear a seatbelt at times I felt like I was taking part in the starsky and hutch movie the drivers all drive NY style - drive, slam on the breaks, drive! I didn't at any time feel unsafe in the area having said that I was never out at night alone however it's no different to any other city be aware and take care. We ate at a typical diner bar cafe round the corner from the hotel each morning and breakfast ranged from $4 to $14 however I'm sure there are other diners in the vacinity. I have travelled widely and stayed everywhere from the 5* Belagio Hotel in Las Vegas to a 1* hotel in Edinburgh and my feeling has always been you get what you pay for. If you want shoe shine men, and swimming pools, room service etc, then you pay for it - your not paying for it at this hotel thus don't expect it. Enjoy your holiday your not going to sit and look at a hotel so get out and about and enjoy NY - PS it's cold very cold so be prepared and take the winter woolies

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel three times now and have never been disappointd. Yes there are marks on the carpets from decorating etc. but the rooms have always been clean. The toilets have been spotless every time. This November the room the wife and I occupied was quite large and did not have any complaints. Very handy for the subway and a good safe area to stay in. Can recommended the Firehouse of Columbus & 85th for a good drink and meal. Also Roths steakhouse also on Columbus.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in November and the first time it was okay. Nothing special but okay. The second time I couldn't believe my eyes. These comments all apply to my second stay. It seems that it is pot luck at this hotel as some rooms are okay and others are truely awful. I had read the reviews and decided that it would be okay as each stay was only one night and you can put up with anything for one night right? Wrong. The room was so small that it was difficult to simply get from the door to the bathroom. It smelled damp and musty but the bathroom was clean and everything worked. There was no alarm clock, the phone was not able to be used as I had prepaid my accommodation. The real problem started when I pulled back the bedspread to get into bed and I thought those sheets don't look very clean. Further inspection revealed several stains that rather conclusively proved they were not clean at all. I wont describe them but they were human in nature and not what you would expect in the worst run hotel on earth. I complained to the receptionist who bluntly stated that he couldn't do anything about it as it was too late. A closer inspection of the room showed a few other undesirable human waste products artistically arranged on the wall. I spent a very uncomfortable night sleeping on top of the bed dreaming about dirty sheets and bugs - at least I hope it was a dream about bugs! The other problem was that I was on a low level floor and the traffic noise from Broadway was truely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “bring your own radio and alarm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was formerly the Quality Inn, at west 94th street. The location is the best thing going for this hotel, which appears to be a combination of several buildings. The regular rooms do not have radio alarm clocks, and the oversized furniture actually cramps the rooms. But the renovated baths are modern and the staff is helpful. The rates are competitive for manhattan, especially if you can get one of the group discount rates such as aaa.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Snavta
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 of the 4 nights I reserved(09/27/05). The sheets were filthy, the bathroom had bugs, the door didn't close all the way, the room did not come with the amenities it said it would (I.E. Cable. We barely got reception let alone HBO), no alarm clock. This was vital to our stay since we were in town for a medical school interview. We had a light bulb out in our room so I went down to the front desk (our phone didn't work) and asked if someone could replace it. The desk staff called someone to change the bulb. A man walked in and said "I ain't changing no lightbulbs. You do it." Then walked out. Needless to say the light bulb was never replaced and there was no appology for the rudeness. I then asked if we could have a phonebook to look at. The man looked annoyed and said they didn't have any phone books. We left the next morning. On top of that they have charged my card for the extra 3 nights that I didn't stay there! I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff is beyond rude and the hotel is filthy!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel when it was a Quality for our 1st wedding anniversary. We didn't need a 4 star hotel as we both work in them, seeing New York was our aim. It had changed to a Days Inn just before our stay and I can honestly say we never experienced any of the little problems or wear and tear that I read about in the reviews. I was a little worried about the lifts, but following advise from previous reviews I stayed to the ones on the left hand side of reception and we were fine. If you are looking for quality or service that you get in a 4 or 5 star hotel this is not the place for you, but if you only want a place to rest after a great days sight seeing this is a good place to stay. The Key West Diner was great ( so much food) and the tube / underground is on the corner and a great way to travel around New York

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice, it smelled like wet dog”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My reservation was moved to this hotel because the original hotel was still under construction. The room was very basic. It smelled like a damp dog, the air conditioner was loud, the hair dryer did not work, there is no fan in the bathroom, but it was bigger than my room at the W. It cost me an extra $16 roundtrip in cabs to get to Midtown/Downtown because it was so far north. But cute neighborhood & close to 96st. Subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God the word Quality is no longer in the name”
Reviews.Author: GB40
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel online and only having the briefest detail on it, I was somewhat nervous after having read the negative reviews on here. I can only say I wished I'd heeded the majority advice and changed hotels. It appears that the hotel has changed hands and become part of the Days Inn chain and boy, have they got some work to do. The foyer is generally ok and check-in was swift although I wasn't happy to be told I couldn't use the room phone as I had pre-paid. It meant all local & national calls had to be made using my mobile (cellphone) and as I'm from the UK, that has cost me a bomb. Why couldn't they take my credit card details like all other hotels do? There are 2 sets of elevators: don't use the ones on the right of reception as they never seem to arrive. Our room had to be entered via the stairway (filthy) and there was no aircon in the halls and corridors so waiting for the elevators was like being in a sauna. The room was reasonably sized considering we would be spending the minimum of time in it and the aircon worked really well. That's the end of the good points. We only had 1 thin pillow each on the double bed; on our first night there we asked for more, they eventually arrived 4 nights later after 5 more requests. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the net curtains were filthy as was the small cupboard over the sink (I refused to open the one under the sink for fear of what I might find.) The carpet was also filthy. The shower and toilet worked fine but the bath plughole was obviously blocked as it filled up with about 4" of water before draining. Again we reported this on the first night; their solution after 3 days was to remove the handle for lowering the plug. Genius! Towel replacement was erratic; initially we had 3 bath towels (not particularly big though) 2 hand towels and 2 flannels. Over the next 4 days these numbers fluctuated form 1 bath towel and 3 flannels to a mix of everything. Overall, I suppose for the rates we paid things could have been worse. However, when I book into an hotel owned by a major chain I expect certain minimum requirements e.g clean room, sufficient bedding, workable ablutions and fairly pleasant surroundings. I am not a snob and I'm not rich; I rarely stay in anything but 2 and 3* hotels. However, this place was not good. Take the majority advice and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quality on B'way”
Reviews.Author: RustyJohnsonCity_TN
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised to read negative comments about this place. When I visited (May 10) we were RELIEVED to be placed in this hotel, after being told upon check-in at the Comfort Inn Central Park West (one of its "sister properties") that something was amiss with our room and they were moving us here. In addition to getting a Quality Inn for Comfort Inn rates :) we were placed on an upper floor and had a very quiet night. The only things I could fault: 1) a tear in one of the curtain liners let in sunlight about dawn; 2) a remodeling project was underway, and a lot of furniture was in the hallway. The staff was very polite. The hotel offers to keep luggage under lock and key so you can check out, shop, and not have to lug the stuff around town. The man who handles this lobby service was wonderful. It isn't the newest place in town but it is fine by my standards.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 nights (inclusive 1.5 year old boy) in this hotel and our conclusion: Not bad at all! + neighborhood (shops, houses, people, central park, subway) + Room (our room: 25 feet + bathroom) + Clean (no rats, clean towels, clean bed) - No design, no marmer; elevators / lobby are aged/ (but who cares?) After this hotel, we spend 2 nights in the luxury hotel " the fairmont" in Washington. Yes, thats a great difference, but also more expensive. So good value, not bad at all! Steef / Holland

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made our reservations through Expedia and was excited about the cheap rates. We decided to go "no frills" considering we would be spending minimal time in the room. A few days prior to the trip I decided to check out the reviews on Trip Advisor and was FRIGHTENED! I joked with my friends that they may not want to walk on the carpet bare footed and shower shoes might be a necessity. I have to say my expectations were surprisingly exceeded. pros: cheap rates (more money to spend shopping); clean sheets & towels; clean carpet; literally a minute walk to the subway station, Starbucks, McDonalds, and a 24 hr Drug Store on the block; nice location for exploring the city with only a 10-15 min. subway ride from Times Square (the express train will get you there faster). cons: small, slow elevator; a/c did not cool very well (although, we could have switched rooms but didn't want to mess with it); rooms are fairly small. Overall, our experience was a great one. We could have stayed in Times Square for 2-3x's as much, but preferred to spend more on purses in China Town and Broadway Shows. Nice home base for tourists on the go. Definitly not the Four Seasons, but a nice place to shower and sleep :)

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ArcticGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here November 2004. The location is absolutely amazing, though the hotel is gross! The elevators are scary and very slow. The room was dirty, ie stains on walls, dirty carpet, mold in bathroom, etc. The most disturbing part of the stay was seeing a cockroach climbing up the wall next to the bed. When I booked the room online through the hotel website, it stated that local calls were free. Well, they weren't. I was charged for every call and by the minute. When I got back home I e-mailed "Choice Hotels" customer service and I was refunded the money for all the local calls. All that I can say is I believe all the negativity in the reviews I read!

Reviews.Title: “Left with servere rashes and bites!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Cousin, a friend and I booked to stay for 8 nights at this hotel and got what we thought was a bargain, when we 1st arrived we'd thought we had done okay as It seemed like a smart pleasant little hotel. The room seemed fine, apart from the room opposite which absolutley reeked of stale smoke and sweat, we think the room belonged to someone who worked there as the lock on the door was an old key lock. The shower leaked when we used it but apart from that for the 1st couple of days we thought things were okay. We was made aware we cpuldn't call out from our room as we had pre paid our room bill and they didn't want us running up a huge bill and not paying for it - which we thought was fare enough, but then when we tried to call into the hotel phone it kept getting diverted to voicemail so the only way we could accept a call was by listening to the message left, we informed reception about this and they said they would look into it....which they NEVER did! Secondly thay tried to charge us a dollar a day for using the safe in the room?! We didn't pat it as it does not state we would be charged, they are very sneeky and we heard them charge other people who had left credit card details. BUT MOST OF ALL.....The day after we all returned home we were absoultley covered in bites-from head to toe! At one point we even thought it may be scabies, we still do not know exactly what they were but mine was more like bites and my friend had come up in big bloches! The either have a very bad bug problem with the beds or they don't wash the linen! Like with most other peoples comments the staff are VERY unhelpful and lazy, also the lifts are very scary and always stopping at the wrong floors, not a bad place to stay for one night but stay any longer than that......then on your own head be it....YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in North America ”
Reviews.Author: KenCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Where do I start...? This Hotel is the worst I have ever stayed in. I had to request towels for the room as only one bathtowel was provided. The Bathroom in the room flooded. We moved to another room. Two nights later there was a mouse in the new room, which I killed in the bathroom and placed on the reception counter in a bag. The staff were ignorant and did not show any sign of concern for what happened. I checked out after the mouse incident and went to a Comfort Inn. Avoid this Hotel at all costs. It's a dump. I'd give it a no star rating. I’d rather sleep in the alleyways of Harlem than to spend another vacation in this Hotel. Under existing management it can only devolve to the status of brothel. DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: mr_xander
Reviews.Content: Quality Inns promise a budget friendly price with little to no frills. On that basis this hotel delivers. Yes, the hotel is in need of repair, yes, the elevators are small and creaky, and yes, the rooms do have problems. However, the price reflects this and given that, the hotel is a real value. The rate is a real bargain. We paid less than $100/day for our room. Our room was clean and kept up every day. There are little amenities like a coffeemaker, hair dryer and refrigerator in the room. Another plus is that the hotel is in a good location, fairly close to the Museum of Natural History as well as Central Park. It’s also just one block from the subway, and although located in the upper west side, travel to Times Square is just a mere 10-15 minutes. On the other hand, the hotel was lacking in other areas. The tiny bathroom was the biggest offender: the bathtub did not drain properly, it was dark (one of the light bulbs needed to be replaced), and the wallpaper was peeling. The staff is slow and forgetful. We waited 20 minutes for the bellhop to place our luggage in storage when we first arrived and I had to report the burned out bulb in the bathroom twice before they fixed it. The concierge was not too competent either. She couldn’t give me an address of a department store I was looking for, so she gave me their phone number so I could call myself. In the end if you are looking for more luxurious lodging, 3 stars and up, then this should not be your choice. However, if you are looking for an acceptable place to sleep while you are out sight seeing for most of the day, then this place fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “I Want My Money Back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Book this hotel at your own risk! My favorite part was when we left. Not only is the staff unfriendly and incompetent, the hotel was under construction the entire time we were there and the place was a mess. The last day there, the numbers on the doors were taken off so we didn't even know which rooms were ours. We rented a rollaway bed and the front desk clerk charged me $479 for it instead of the $15 it should have cost. When I brought this to their attention, there was no apology, as if this sort of thing happens quite often. The rooms were small, the air conditioning didn't work, and there was a strange smell that we never could figure out. Reading the prior reviews, I thought people were exagerating because the place couldn't be that bad....I was wrong, it was worse!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to New York for our Honeymoon in April 05 for a week. We chose this hotel as the photos in the brochure looked lovely and it was reasonably priced. However, we now wish we'd paid a bit more and stayed somewhere else!! We arrived at the hotel and it was rather run down and tatty. Our first room (no 109) was tiny. We thought, 'ok we won't be here much' but when we ventured into the bathroom we found a large brown puddle in the middle of the floor which was formed from a dripping in the ceiling above (round the light fitting!) Needless to say, my husband called reception straight away and explained the situation and we asked to be moved to another room, which we did. I know this is a pretty cheap hotel, but I would not expect to be faced with this no matter where I stayed! Our second room was better, but the whole hotel could do with a clean and refurb!! However, we did have a fabulous time in NY...we weren't about to let this spoil our holiday. But I would only recommend this place to backpackers and the like...definately not honeymooners!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For that money in New York, especially in Manhatten so close to everything, I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. My room was clean, the staff was friendly and it's close to the subway. Granted, the sheets and blankets are thin, the elevators are small and slow, the lobby shows some wear and tear, but it's great when you consider how low the price is. The staff was very helpful when I asked them for suggestions on good places to eat and also when I asked them what subways I needed to take to get to Union Square. It's a great location if you're flying into La Guardia and don't have the money for a cab, because the bus will take you down Broadway to just a couple blocks north of 94th. There's also a drug store on the same corner as the hotel, which is very convenient if you forget your toothbrush (like I did). I am planning to stay there again on my next trip to New York and would recommend that anyone on a tight budget do the same.

Reviews.Title: “OMG...living nightmare.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst. Hotel. Ever. And I've stayed in some dumps in my uni years... The lobby was covered in building material, the staff were rude and unhelpful. We were trying to book flights for the next stage of our trip to chicago and no one would help us locate the nearest travel agent. We ended up asking the concierge of another hotel. The heating was broken, the room was so cramped you had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom, the smell in the halls and lifts were horrible. I;ll be going back to NYC many times in the future but never ever will I go near this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Scene from a horror film”
Reviews.Author: audacious200
Reviews.Content: I visited with some friends on a 6th form college trip, our total number being 29, so we had alot of rooms, but the group were spread out over all floors. When we first arrived our eyes were immediatly drawn to the 'danger' tape in the corner of the lobby where the plaster was falling off the ceiling. I hoped that things would get better, unfortunatly they did not. One of the lifts was out of order, so rather then wait around i choose to use the main stairs. These were fine till we reached 5th floor where there was all kinds of rubbish and cigarette ash along with flammable liquids with lids of ect. My room was shared with 3 others yet only 3 keys were provided and only 3 sets f towels ect. The bed was not terrible but when i first arrived we had to remove the top cover and shake the dust off. The shower was also a cause for concern, it would not keep a stable temperature and when my friend had finished, the hot water tap would not turn off and the bath was filling up as the plug stuck. it took 3 people to turn the tap off. None of the showers in friends rooms kept a temperature either. We were the lucky ones, we had a kitchenette part in our room, but many people had small cramped rooms which with 2 double beds can cause problems in moving about and storage of suitcases ect. In one bedroom a mousetrap was found set under the bed, and in another cockroches were living. The staff on a whole were not friendly or helpful. When my friends and I ordered Chinease takeaway, and had it in our room, we did not wish to keep the left overs in the room, given findings elsewhere we did not want to encourage insects in our room. When we took down the rubbish they glared at us for daring to disturb them and snapped that there was a bin in the lobby. The back stairway was even worse then the front. It had doors and curtain poles on the stairs. These did not seem a very health and safety way about things. Overall my stay in New York was good, but i spent as little time as possible in the hotel. We hope to return there again sometime, but will not be staying in the same hotel. If you are considering a stay in this hotel, i urge you to reconsider immediatly!

Reviews.Title: “Should have gone for the Plaza!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived here in Novemeber a day before my 21st birthday so anyone who has visited this hotel can sympathise on how i felt on my arrival First we sat in the so called lobby area which looked like something out of a scary film while the so called receptionist looked up our reservation....30 mins later we where taken to a room on the 10th floor....as we walked down the corridors the hotel stunk of smoke and mould...not inpressed with the room which had a leaking radiator ratteling windows and just smelt awfull we went back down 10 flights of STAIRS as i was too scared to go back in the lift due to its random juddring and floor stopping We where re located to a more acceptable room on the 4th floor (although the toilet did over flow twice and the showers heat was very inpredictable...with no bath mat!!) and for 4 nights we took to the stairs everyday....not to mention spending the first night looking around New York for another hotel to stay in.... Over all New York was fantastic and i would definatly go back again...but for the hotel never ever again...at least it will be a 21st birthday to remeber in more ways then one!!!

Reviews.Title: “it is not as bad as people make out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i visited the quality hotel between the 9th and 13th of march 2005 with my college.prior to arrival i was worried about what the hotel would be like because i had read a number of bad reviews. however upon arrival our group was greeted by the door man. he was very pleasent and told us where the best places in New York were. the room i shared with my friend was clean the bed sheets were clean and the room was tidy. the bathroom was accaeptable,except for the mould that was building up on the bath seem. the room had all the basic ammenitys such as a phone table safe wardrobe t.v a lamp and a hair drier. the beds were cleaned every day and the room had being vacumed, except for the edges. they could have being vacumed better. The carpet could also be re fitted. the lifts were a problem. I waited ages for a lift and when it did come it decided to stop on numerous floors for no reason.If your looking for luxury then dont choose this hotel but if you want a cheap and acceptable hotel then the quality hotel is just right. THe location is very good.It is close to the sub way,central park and there are a number of good places to eat i would recommend the key west dinner for breakfast as they serve large portions at low prices. Next to the hotel is a 24 hour convenience store which sells most things you need.overall the quality hotel is worth visiting if you have come to new york to site see and you dont spend a lot of time in hotels and your looking for a cheap and acceptable hotel it is worth visiting

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: subwayrat
Reviews.Content: The halls are scary looking (dirty and poorly maintained), the elevator feels like a tiny deathtrap, and the place appeared to be severely understaffed. But the room itself was fine, albeit small. But for the money (about 30% less than just about anything else) it was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, no... Hotel, yes... on broadway, no...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in December of 2004. Upon our arrival we were greeted with a wonderful aroma of curry mixed with cigarette smoke which lingered through the entire building. I was not impressed with the lobby area which scared me as typically what lies beyond that area isn't usually any more impressive. We checked in (which was somewhat of a challenge since they had no record of our reservation which was confirmed twice prior to arrival) and entered the refrigerator sized elevator. Once we got to our floor, we tried to make our way through the labyrinth of narrow hallways and misleading signs that led us in circles on the way to our room. Our room was cramped to say the least, and looking out our window we were delighted to find an old sock sitting on our window sill. The radiator was loud and archaic and the room temperature fluctuated between 50 and 90 degrees F, and any tinkering with the thermostat was futile. On the morning of our second day we were forced to brush our teeth with bottled water and go without showering de to the fact that there was no water in the building. After arguing with the concierge for what seemed to be an eternity, I was led to the conclusion that they beleived running water was a luxury I didn't request. Shame on me for not asking that question. The only reason we stayed in this hotel was due to some last minute planning for a quick weekend away. Next time I'm bringing my tent and sleeping in Central Park. Then at least I won't be able to complain about not having any running water.

Reviews.Title: “Quality??? They are being ironic we think?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Hotel on 94th Street and Broadway for a week in mid-february 2005 for 4 nights. The position of the hotel was excellent, close to the subway, convenience store and Central Park with some great places to eat nearby (I recommend the Key West Diner for breakfast). The towels and bed linen etc were changed daily and the lobby was also attractive and welcoming. HOWEVER, visiting the hotel as part of a group of 20, I had access to many rooms. To our astonishment when one room unlocked their door after we arrived there was a man asleep in the room. One room discovered several cockroaches, one girl's clothes were thrown away by the maid, the plug in my sink was stuck making it completely un-usuable and the radiator leaked onto the carpet. (With which the reception staff were most un-helpful). To add to the shabbiness, when the radiator leaked the true state of the carpet became apparent when bright yellow dirt rose to the surface of the carpet. Simply leaving the hotel was a chore, as waiting for the elevator for 10 minutes was not uncommon, and once you were on it, it was dirty, cramped and stopped on every floor. For a short stay the Quality Hotel is not bad, as it is in a good setting with all the basics, such as a TV and fridge etc and when asking for more towels etc the staff are very efficient. However, the rooms were in desperate need of up-dating, the carpet and curtains etc were beyond dirty, to the point where bare-feet simply was not an option and on a couple of occasions we slept with just a sheet as the rest of the bed-linen looked unwashed. Would I choose to stay there again, or recommend it to others??? I think not!

Reviews.Title: “First Rate for the price”
Reviews.Author: Burp3086
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights at the end of January and for the price we couldn't have bettered it. It is in the same price bracket as shared bathroom accommodation (which I have done in New York and would not do again). The room we had was large (by New York standards) with 2 double beds, was clean (maybe the very edges of the carpet aren't vacuumed - I don't normally walk on those bits) and serviced every day. Any requests for extra towels, or blankets was dealt with quickly and efficiently. By no stretch of the imagination is this a luxurious, stylish hotel - but what do you expect? The staff were also all friendly and helpful. The location is excellent - local shops , and excellent diner on 100th St (Metro Diner - 1st class breakfast with character service) Starbucks, pharmacies, grocery stores - the subway less than a stones throw away and Central Park 2 blocks. I would definitely stay here again. One more point - how much time do you want to spend in your room while in New York - there is so much to do out there, and if you stay here you will have more money to spend out there having the time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “What Quality?!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend trip to New York, we stayed 3 nights in the hotel and I really wouldn't recommend it to any one. When we arrived we had specified a non smoking room but the room we were allocated smelt like an old ashtray and the toilet was blocked, when we complained the staff seemed slightly surprised but offered us an alternative room on the 12th floor which we accepted. This also stank of smoke but was ok once we opened a window. While moving our baggage we then got stuck in the lift for 10 minutes while it juddered between the 12th and 14th floors. The room was quiet but grubby(you wouldn't want to walk on the carpet in bare feet) and the shower filled the bath so you had to wait between showers although there was plenty of hot water. The communal area's were pretty grubby and the hotel also has flats with permanent residents in it so strong cooking smells in the corridors. I know this might sound fussy but i've done alot of back packing mostly in third world countries staying in hostels and stuff and i've got to stay at least they were clean! if you want a nice trip don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “What are all these people complaining about?????”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveller
Reviews.Content: I don't quite understand what all these people have been complaining about. I stayed here for 5 days and had no problems what so ever. Let me first say that this is a budget property and as such is nothing flash, but I didn't come to New York for a flashy hotel. The building itself is old and a little run down but certainly has some character. The rooms are huge by New York standards with quite a good sized bathroom as well. The room was serviced every day and I had no issue with the cleanliness. The guy at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. My luggage was lost by the airline and he went out of his way to help me (very un-New York like) The area is more residential and is only 2 blocks from central park. The Subway is literally across the road and was only 2 stops from Times Square. If you want to walk to major attractions, forget it, its too far, the subway is just as easy though. There are several delis and convenience stores with 1 block of the hotel, as well as Starbucks, McDonalds, a Diner, and a great Thai Restaurant 'The Lemongrass Grill' which had great food and was quite cheap. I certainly felt safe walking around the area. I can only assume that some of the previous reviewers had much to high expectations for a property that doesn't claim to be anything more than it is for the price you pay. I'd stay here again with no hesitation. Oh and make sure you get a bacon egg and cheese bagel made fresh in the morning from the deli across the road. The were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Better than these other reviews give credit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from this hotel, stayed 14-19 Dec 04. After reading the reviews on this website we were concerned we'd have to find alternative accommodation. However we were more than happy. The room we had (923) was of a good size, comfortably had two double beds, and a small bathroom. It was very clean, new sheets and matresses and the floor was hoovered daily when they also changed our sheets and towels. Yes the furniture is old, but not falling apart and the shower was excellent, even if it did drain away a bit slowly. For what we paid (£450 inc Virgin flights from London for 5 nights) we were more than happy. Not having looked in any of the other rooms, I can't disagree with what other people have said, but did the bad reviewers stay in the same hotel as us or are they just increadibly picky?? If so, I would recommend The Four Seasons or The Plaza, or just the saying 'you get what you pay for'. Please don't be concerned about staying here, we found the hotel staff more than helpful and very friendly. And you have to eat at the City Diner, about 92nd & Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “No Quality at The Quality Hotel on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in December 2004 & after reading several "concerning" reviews our fears were confirmed on arrival. The staff were very unfriendly & unhelpful apart from one porter. The room we were given smelt of cigarette smoke & was shabby & unclean. The curtains were full of dust & hadn't been cleaned in ages & the bedding had cigarette burns in it. After staying in the room for just one night, my friend woke the next morning to find that she was not alone in her bed! There was a cockroach in it! We immediately telephoned reception & were told that someone would be up shortly. After 20 minutes someone came up & took the cockroach away & didn't seem very concerned about what we had found. We weren't offered another room & had to go to reception at 5.30 in the morning to find out what they intended to do with it. They didn't seem at all bothered & seemed a little suprised that we were so concerned about it. They eventually offered to give us another room. We had to pack up our belongings & have them stored whilst we went out for the day. We came back at night to a different member of staff on the desk who didn't seem to have a clue about what had happened. We were eventually given another room but on approaching that room, we found the door wide open, all the lights on & the T.V. on. We did not feel at all safe. We were moved again & our 3rd room (in a 4 night stay!) & was probably the best out of the 3. We received no apology for what had happened or the inconvenience of it all. Definately wouldn't stay in this hotel again! There is absolutely no "quality" at The Quality Hotel on Broadway" & is too far out from all main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “average for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I visited this hotel Dec 2004 and found the rooms ok. I had asked for two non smoking rooms one was the other one the ashtray was in the chest of drawers and my sheets smelt of smoke but what the hell a quick spray of perfume and I was out for the count anyway. The window did not shut that well but we all used our earplugs anyway and I have stayed in a 5 star hotel this year and I think people are too quick compare places with there own home of places they have stayed in before. You go to New York to take in the sights and shop till you drop and if you are going to complain about the room all i can say is you can't of filled your day enough. We where so tired it did not matter. Keywest diner is good for breakfast and the hotel is handy for the subway. We shall return to New York as its the most amazing city and if you want a cheap break use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Tracylou29
Reviews.Content: I read loads of bad reports about this hotel before we went to New York and was quite nervous about staying there. However we were pleasantly surprised as it wasn't as bad we thought it was going to be. The hotel is very old and desperatly in need of a makeover, however, the bed sheets were very clean as was the mattress, the towels were also very clean and both were changed daily. The carpet and curtains in the room were very old and were quite dirty, so take your slippers to walk about in. Having given most of the bad points, I found this a good base, we didn't spend much time there anyway. A taxi down into the heart of New York only costs $10 or there is the subway right out on Broadway only a 2 minute walk away. You must try the City Diner whilst you are there, the food is superb !! come out of the hotel and onto broadway - turn left and walk up broadway twds the city and you will find City Diner further up the street on the opposite side - nearly opposite Tal Bagel. This was our first time in New York and it won't be the last !! We probably won't stay at the quality hotel again, but it certainly has not put us off New York - what a fantastic city !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Start spreading the news....................”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this hotel the day before I travelled. I was really worried that my eagerly anticipated trip would be ruined. To say I was pleasantly surprised would be way too generous but, it was not as bad as I had been led to believe. The room was on the 2nd floor so the lifts were no problem, although I preferred the stairs as the lifts looked like they would break down any second. The room itself was pitch black even during the day! This was due to the windows being obscured by polythene sheeting. It was very dark. The bathroom was light and clean, the towels were changed every day. More towels were requested and were left the next day. The beds were large and comfortable, the matresses were clean and the sheets were too. These were changed everyday. The floor was the biggest problem, the carpet was dark red, and was filthy. We never walked on the carpet in bare feet! The corners of the room were thick with dust and grime. The fixtures were old and drab. However, the trip was still amazing and the hotel could have been much worse. I would never stay there again! I saw no creepy crawlies, apart from a man around the corner who bored us stupid everyday. Watch out for him, he shines shoes, and has a scam going where he will tell you where you got your shoes. Take my advice tell him your shoes are on Broadway, New York City. You wont be in the room for long as there is way to much happening outside! The Key West diner around the corner is really good. Their cocktails sent me to sleep in my less than average room.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy Birthday”
Reviews.Author: medical49
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay at this grisily hotel in November for my 50th birthday. This hotel was absolutely disgusting. This hotel was booked through a travel agent and was not a cheap package. The rooms were nothing like advertised on the web they were very small with single beds. The carpets were dirty as was everything else in the room. I was also bitten on my arms and legs. I had to sleep on bath towels because the beds were so dirty. They left 2 plastic vending cups for coffe but I could not drink or eat anthing in that disgusting room. To top all this off there were cockroches in this room. All this made for a unhappy 50th birthday. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL. It is hell.

Reviews.Title: “NOT QUALITY !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is quite the worst hotel we've ever been allocated. The foyer is shabby, crammed with hampers of linen, decor well past it's best. The lift was disgusting, dirty and smelly. The room was not clean, stained windows, dirty and tattered curtains. The single seat was stained and unuseable, the room phone did not work and thebedding looked suspect. We stayed one night, sleeping fully dressed on top of the bed. Reception staff did not seem surprised at our departure. We are not fussy travellers, we wanted a basic room while we shopped,this hotel did not meet even our basic requirements of cleanliness and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “OK just.....”
Reviews.Author: PaulCrawford
Reviews.Content: Personally would not stay there again. Did not feel 100% safe. We may be too choosey however stayed there four nights (1 - 5 Dec) and found 3 cockroaches, one escaped capture... Room, well OK except alot of things were broken or kind of fixed. Corners of room had not seen a cleaner for several months. No hot water one morning. TV reception was poor. Most things worked Ok however the room was very tired. I know NY is not cheap, however could have found a cheaper / better hotel in London. Bellman was helpful and had a good sense of humour. Mexican food next door I would recommend. Subway very close on 96th. Good good places to eat breakfast close by. Overall just OK, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting........”
Reviews.Author: Shari27
Reviews.Content: Guess they were renovating...parts of the room fine, others not so good. Carpet was more like padding, mold around tub area. Hall ways and elevators need sprucing up but location near the subway was great. Better to stay nearer midtown if you're doing the tourist things. Staff was helpful, esp. the bellmen.

Reviews.Title: “resonable price, reasonable cost, reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I didn't pay or 5th avenue, the place was clean & tidy after a long flight, room was what we asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Quality? You must be joking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We started to worry at the smell of urine in the corridor on the way to our room. It got worse when we killed the first cockroach on the bed. The wallpaper was peeling, the room was generally grubby, and the blinds had to be kept shut at all times as the view was of other rooms. A request for a hairdryer was ignored for 30 minutes and then we were told there were none available. We were not expecting much from a moderately priced hotel, but this was probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality on Broadway for a week over St. Patricks day in 2004. It may not be the most luxurious hotel but it is very reasonably priced and it is such a good location, literally 2 minutes walk to the subway. I would say very good base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied (for second time)”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our second stay at this hotel. Each visit has been for a full week. Our first stay was in April 2002; our second stay in late September/early October 2004 cost almost exactly double--an encouraging sign, I suppose, that New York tourism is prospering once again. We feel that the Quality Hotel is worth every penny even at the higher rate. Rooms small but clean and comfortable. Had small frig both times. Bathrooms shiny and new but be careful on those darn tile floors. 94th Street sounds remote but in practice not a problem at all. There are bus stops and an express subway stop almost at the door--you can be anywhere in no time--we made it one day to the Staten Island ferry in just 25 minutes. There is a real neighbourhood feel to the area that is a refreshing change after a day in the more boisterous tourist-clogged areas. Safe walking area even at night, people sitting out on the boulevard benches at midnight. Good, reasonably-priced restaurants abound in this area. Key West Diner on ground floor of hotel open all hours and has intriguing Manhattan staff and clientele, excellent, cheap breakfasts, though other meals more variable. Also a Tex-Mex place right in hotel but we didn't try it. People often complain, in particular, of two things at New York budget hotels--lousy elevators and lousy windows/views. Here this place shines: there are four elevators (we have never had to wait more than a minute) and both our rooms have had big windows overlooking not a neighbouring wall or air shaft but a sunfilled street view and a beaut of a view, too, Broadway at its Upper West side widest, with a boulevard full of trees and flowers. Staff seemed reasonably courteous and efficient: wakeup calls made as requested, early morning cab call made as requested, and a plugged toilet fixed one morning between time we left for breakfast and our return.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Hotel Broadway
HotelInfo.Address: 215 W 94th St & Broadway, New York City, NY 10025
